analyzed: de yang rtag pa'i dus ni khyad par du zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod do // yul ni yul phyogs so //

analyzed: de ni gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis brjod do //

original: rang bzhin ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo ste /

translated: Therefore, it is the secret which arises from the solitude that is free from the conceptual thoughts of ordinary people.

original: de yang dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dpa' mo sum cu rtsa bdun dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dpal he ru ka bsgom pa'i gnas dang dam tshig gi spyod pa la sogs pa ji srid pa ni rgyud kyis ston te 'di nyid kyi phyir de nyid brjod
analyzed: de yang dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dpa' mo sum cu rtsa bdun dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dpal he ru ka bsgom pa'i gnas dang dam tshig gi spyod pa la sogs pa ji srid pa ni rgyud kyis ston te 'di nyid kyi phyir de nyid brjod
translated: Moreover, the place of meditation on glorious Heruka, endowed with the twenty-four heroes and the thirty-seven heroines, and the conduct of the commitments, and so forth, are taught by the tantra, and it is for this very reason that it is called the Tantra of the Secret.

original: bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir yang dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i don dang sku bshad par bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir yang dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i don dang sku bshad par bya zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe meaning of Sri Chakrasamvara and the body should be explained.‚Äù

original: sku ni rjod byed du byas te sku rjod byed du byas pa nyid kyis brjod bya gsal bar byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sku ni rjod byed du byas te sku rjod byed du byas pa nyid kyis brjod bya gsal bar byas pa nyid do //
translated: The body is the means of expression, and by being the means of expression of the body, the expressed meaning is clarified.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gnyis brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gnyis brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the two, the means of expression and the expressed meaning, are related by the definition of the means of expression and the expressed meaning.

original: 'di'i phyir rjod byed kyi dgos pa ni phyin ci ma log par brjod par bya ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir rjod byed kyi dgos pa ni phyin ci ma log par brjod par bya ba ston pa'o //
translated: For this reason, the purpose of the means of expression is to teach the expressed meaning without error.

original: brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ni 'di nyid yongs su shes par byas nas mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ni 'di nyid yongs su shes par byas nas mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The purpose of the expressed meaning is to actualize it after fully understanding it.

original: de'i yang dgos pa ni chos ston pa la sogs pas 'gro ba'i don byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yang dgos pa ni chos ston pa la sogs pas 'gro ba'i don byed pa ste /
translated: The purpose of that is to benefit migrating beings by teaching the dharma and so on,

original: mngon du ma byas na gzhan la ston par mi nus so //
analyzed: mngon du ma byas na gzhan la ston par mi nus so //
translated: because if it is not actualized, it cannot be taught to others.

original: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ste /
translated: The relationship is defined as the means and the result of the means.

original: thabs ni 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thabs ni 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The means is the characteristic of the wheel of the ma·πá·∏çala, and so on.

original: de yang ji ltar 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par yul la nye bar longs spyod pas @143a * //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par yul la nye bar longs spyod pas @143a * //
translated: Moreover, it is the enjoyment of the object in accordance with one‚Äôs desire.

original: goms bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: goms bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the practice, it is the means.

original: thabs las byung ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: thabs las byung ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The result of the means is nonabiding nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As such:

original: 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs //
translated: The connection, the concordance, and the means

original: skyes bu'i don ni rjod byed pa //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ni rjod byed pa //
translated: are the expression of the purpose of the person.

original: ngag ni yongs su brtags par rigs //
analyzed: ngag ni yongs su brtags par rigs //
translated: It is reasonable to examine speech.

original: de las gzhan ni brtag bya min ;
analyzed: de las gzhan ni brtag bya min ;
translated: It is not to be examined elsewhere.

original: / bdag gis re zhig bsdus pa'i don du gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: / bdag gis re zhig bsdus pa'i don du gsol ba btab pa /
translated: Having requested the concise meaning,

original: ci shes snyam pa'i rdo rje phag mo'i dogs pa bsu ba'i don du 'di nyid bshad ce na gsungs pa /üîΩmdor bsdus pa ste zhes bya ste kun sdud pas na /
analyzed: ci shes snyam pa'i rdo rje phag mo'i dogs pa bsu ba'i don du 'di nyid bshad ce na gsungs pa / mdor bsdus pa ste zhes bya ste kun sdud pas na /
translated: if it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is this explained in order to dispel VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´‚Äôs doubt about what is known?‚ÄùüîΩit is said, ‚ÄúIn brief‚Äù means ‚Äúin summary.‚Äù

original: mdor bsdus pa ni nyung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni nyung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn brief‚Äù is ‚Äúin few words.‚Äù

original: de la don nam gzhung gang yin snyam pa la rgyas par min zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la don nam gzhung gang yin snyam pa la rgyas par min zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, one might think, What is the meaning or text? Not extensive is said.

original: min ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: min ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: Not is a restrictive particle.

original: don bsdus pa kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: don bsdus pa kho na ma yin no //
translated: It is not just a summary of the meaning.

original: don la dogs pa bsal ba'i don du sgra bsdus pa yin gyi don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don la dogs pa bsal ba'i don du sgra bsdus pa yin gyi don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the text is condensed for the purpose of removing doubts about the meaning, but the meaning is not.

original: gzhung bsdus pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa kho nar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung bsdus pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa kho nar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that it is only asserted to be a condensation of the text.

original: don bsdus par ma yin par ji ltar shes na rgyas par zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: don bsdus par ma yin par ji ltar shes na rgyas par zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: How is it known that it is not a condensation of the meaning? It is said extensive.

original: gang gi phyir don mang po nyid ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don mang po nyid ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: Because many meanings are extensive.

original: gal te 'di la don bsdus pa yin pa de lta na ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' dad mnyam pa'i rgyud las ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di la don bsdus pa yin pa de lta na ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' dad mnyam pa'i rgyud las ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a condensation of the meaning here, then the intended meaning would not be accomplished, and it would not be taught in the Tantra Equal to Space.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i gzhung las mdor ba sdus nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i gzhung las mdor ba sdus nas /
translated: Having condensed the text of the Tantra Equal to Space,

original: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rgyud la lhag par mos shing 'dod pa'i gdul bya'i mos pa'i dbang gis ston pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rgyud la lhag par mos shing 'dod pa'i gdul bya'i mos pa'i dbang gis ston pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: The teacher taught the glorious Wheel of Time Tantra out of a desire to benefit those disciples who have a special interest in that tantra and who are inclined to desire.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gdul bya la 'dod chags la sogs pa de nyid ston te /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gdul bya la 'dod chags la sogs pa de nyid ston te /
translated: Thus, the teacher taught desire and so forth to those disciples who are to be guided by desire and so forth.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar me yis tshig pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar me yis tshig pa la //
translated: Just as one who is burned by fire

original: yang ni me yis gdung bar bya //
analyzed: yang ni me yis gdung bar bya //
translated: Is burned again by fire,

original: de bzhin 'dod chags mes tshig la //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags mes tshig la //
translated: So one who is burned by the fire of desire

original: 'dod chags me yis gdung bar bya //
analyzed: 'dod chags me yis gdung bar bya //
translated: Is burned again by the fire of desire.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover:üîΩThere is no sin in the three worlds like desire,

original: gzhan yang / 'dod chags bral blta bu'i sdig / khams gsum na ni gzhan med de //üîΩde phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dod chags bral blta bu'i sdig / khams gsum na ni gzhan med de // de phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba //
translated: And there is no happiness like the happiness of being free from desire.

original: nam yang khyod kyis mi bya'o //
analyzed: nam yang khyod kyis mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should never be free from desire.

original: zhes bya'o // gsang ba'i tshig gi don gang bstan pa de nyid cung zad rgyas par 'chad de he ru ka dpal zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gsang ba'i tshig gi don gang bstan pa de nyid cung zad rgyas par 'chad de he ru ka dpal zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the secret words that were taught is explained in a slightly more extensive way in the words ‚Äúthe glorious Heruka.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu zhal dang phyag la sogs pa'i gzugs su sbyor ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhal dang phyag la sogs pa'i gzugs su sbyor ba ni yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application to the form of faces, arms, and so on, is the correct application.

original: ga ta ni las kyi @143b rkyen du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ga ta ni las kyi @143b rkyen du byas pa'o //
translated: Ga is the condition of action.

original: dpal ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su mngon par 'dzin no //
analyzed: dpal ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su mngon par 'dzin no //
translated: Sri is the apprehension of nondual pristine awareness.

original: he ni rgyu la sogs pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: he ni rgyu la sogs pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: He is the emptiness of causes and so on.

original: ru ni smon pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ru ni smon pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Ru is the freedom from wishes.

original: ka ni gang du yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ka ni gang du yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Ka is the nonabiding anywhere.

original: dpal he ru ka zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, it is the glorious Heruka.üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / shr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
analyzed: de yang / shr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
translated: Sri is nondual pristine awareness.üîΩHe is the emptiness of causes and so on.

original: he ni rgyu sogs stong pa nyid ru ni tshogs dang bral ba ste //
analyzed: he ni rgyu sogs stong pa nyid ru ni tshogs dang bral ba ste //
translated: Ru is the freedom from the aggregates.

original: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ka is the nonabiding anywhere.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / shr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
analyzed: gzhan yang / shr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
translated: Sri is nondual pristine awareness.

original: he yis rgyu ni spangs pa ste //
analyzed: he yis rgyu ni spangs pa ste //
translated: He is the abandonment of causes.

original: ru ni gzugs las nges par grol //
analyzed: ru ni gzugs las nges par grol //
translated: Ru is the definite freedom from form.

original: ka yis byed pa las grol pa'o //
analyzed: ka yis byed pa las grol pa'o //
translated: Ka is the freedom from action.

original: blta bar bya bas na gzugs so //
analyzed: blta bar bya bas na gzugs so //
translated: The object of seeing is form.

original: byed pa ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Action is the sense faculties and so on.

original: yang na / he sa ni bdud las rgyal ba ste //
analyzed: yang na / he sa ni bdud las rgyal ba ste //
translated: he means victory over the demons,

original: rus ni phyogs sgo thams cad 'gengs //
analyzed: rus ni phyogs sgo thams cad 'gengs //
translated: his clan is the filling of all directions and gates,

original: ka ni rtog pa'i dra las grol //
analyzed: ka ni rtog pa'i dra las grol //
translated: his ka means liberation from the net of conceptualization.

original: des ni he ru ka zhes brjod //
analyzed: des ni he ru ka zhes brjod //
translated: Thus he is called Heruka.

original: he ru ka dpal rdo rje phag mo de dang ldan pa'i he ru ka la dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba ni tshig dbu ma phyis pa'i bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: he ru ka dpal rdo rje phag mo de dang ldan pa'i he ru ka la dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba ni tshig dbu ma phyis pa'i bsdu ba ste /
translated: The glorious Heruka is the glorious Heruka who possesses that Vajravarahi. This is a compound with the middle term elided,

original: rims zhi bar byed pa'i sngags la rims kyi sngags zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rims zhi bar byed pa'i sngags la rims kyi sngags zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: like the mantra of fever in the mantra for curing fever.

original: yang dag sbyor ba nyid mi khyad par ro //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba nyid mi khyad par ro //
translated: The true yoga itself is not distinguished.

original: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pas khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pas khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because of what is intended, the distinction and the basis of the distinction are intended.

original: de bzhin du dpal he ru ka yang dag par sbyor ba yang de'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal he ru ka yang dag par sbyor ba yang de'o //
translated: In the same way, the true yoga of the glorious Heruka is that.

original: dpal he ru ka ni gsang ba'i sgra brjod par bya ba'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka ni gsang ba'i sgra brjod par bya ba'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: The glorious Heruka is one part of the secret term to be expressed.

original: de bshad par bya zhes sngon du song ba'i bya ba nyid dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bshad par bya zhes sngon du song ba'i bya ba nyid dang sbyor ro //
translated: That is to be explained is connected to the previous action.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dpal he ru ka bstan nas /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dpal he ru ka bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the glorious Heruka, the perfection of one's own aim,

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas de khyad par du byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas de khyad par du byed pa ni /
translated: the perfection of the aim of others is distinguished by way of

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: all and so forth.

original: thams cad ni dgra bo dang mdza' bo dang tha mal ba rnams dang lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad ni dgra bo dang mdza' bo dang tha mal ba rnams dang lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'am /
translated: All means enemies, friends, and neutrals, gods, titans, and so forth, or

original: sems can gyi 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ste yid las 'dod pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ste yid las 'dod pa'i bar ro //
translated: sentient beings' desires, that is, their wishes, up to the mental desires.

original: de rnams kyi don gyi yul ni yul te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don gyi yul ni yul te /
translated: The object of their aim is the object.

original: de yang bde ba ma rnyed pa rnyed ba dang / rnyed pa mi 'bral ba dang / sdug bsngal byung ba dang mi sbyor ba dang / ma byung ba mi bskyed par de la sgrub pa pos mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bde ba ma rnyed pa rnyed ba dang / rnyed pa mi 'bral ba dang / sdug bsngal byung ba dang mi sbyor ba dang / ma byung ba mi bskyed par de la sgrub pa pos mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the adept should manifest that, which is the attainment of pleasure not yet attained, the non-separation from pleasure attained, the non-association with suffering arisen, and the non-generation of suffering not yet arisen.

original: sgrub pa po thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa po thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the adept's common and uncommon practice?

original: bla ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bla ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said from the guru and so forth.

original: gtso bo las kyang gtso bo @144a * //
analyzed: gtso bo las kyang gtso bo @144a * //
translated: The principal is also the principal.

original: ste ; he ru ka dpal sbyor ba la 'jug pa'i yan lag tu gang gi phyir gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ste ; he ru ka dpal sbyor ba la 'jug pa'i yan lag tu gang gi phyir gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: The and so on is for the sake of including the other limbs of the yoga of glorious Heruka, and it is taught as the principal [limb].

original: gtso bo ma yin na de las lhag par mos pa yang gtso bo nyid ma yin par grub pas mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin na de las lhag par mos pa yang gtso bo nyid ma yin par grub pas mi 'jug ste /
translated: If it were not principal, then the devotion to what is superior to it would not be principal, and so would not be engaged.

original: de rnams de la gtso bo ma yin pa'i blo med do //
analyzed: de rnams de la gtso bo ma yin pa'i blo med do //
translated: There is no cognition of it as not principal.

original: gtso bo yang de las lhag par mos pa rnams la gtso bor bstan pas 'jug ste /
analyzed: gtso bo yang de las lhag par mos pa rnams la gtso bor bstan pas 'jug ste /
translated: The principal is taught as principal for those who have devotion to what is superior to it.

original: 'di nyid chos nyid de thun mong ma yin par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'di nyid chos nyid de thun mong ma yin par 'dod pas so //
translated: This is the nature of things, because it is accepted as not common.

original: gang gi phyir bla mar gyur pa'i lha gzhan yod kyang de las kyang bla mar gyur pa'i lha dpal he ru ka zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bla mar gyur pa'i lha gzhan yod kyang de las kyang bla mar gyur pa'i lha dpal he ru ka zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Even though there are other deities that are superior, it is thought, The deity that is superior to that is the glorious Heruka.

original: yang na phul du byung ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la shin tu sbyor bas nyan thos la sogs pa las bla ma bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: yang na phul du byung ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la shin tu sbyor bas nyan thos la sogs pa las bla ma bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Or else, the BhagavƒÅn is superior to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on because he is very much engaged in the accumulation of the excellent merit and wisdom.

original: 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang thabs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang thabs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of one's own aim and the perfection of means.

original: bla ma las bla ma yin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: bla ma las bla ma yin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is he a guru of gurus?

original: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩd'a ni dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes bdag nyid kyis mngon du byed nus pa 'di'i ngang tshul lo zhes pa d'a yi ni ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // d'a ni dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes bdag nyid kyis mngon du byed nus pa 'di'i ngang tshul lo zhes pa d'a yi ni ste /
translated: He declares dakini, etc.

original: nges pa'i tshig gis kar byas pas d'a ki n'i'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gis kar byas pas d'a ki n'i'o //
translated: Dakini is the one who has the nature of being able to manifest the knowledge of the absence of objective reference, with the i of dakini being made into a ka by etymology.

original: gang gi phyir dee ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dee ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba ste /
translated: Dakini is the one who goes in the sky,

original: 'dir skad kyi byings las rnam par dag pa nam mkha' la 'gro ba ni bya ste de dang 'dra bas thabs dang ldan pa ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: 'dir skad kyi byings las rnam par dag pa nam mkha' la 'gro ba ni bya ste de dang 'dra bas thabs dang ldan pa ni nam mkha'o //
translated: here the verbal root is purified, and one goes in the sky. Since she is like that, she is the one who has the means.

original: de yang 'dir dmigs pa med pa'i lam gyi gshog pas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir dmigs pa med pa'i lam gyi gshog pas 'gro ba'o //
translated: She also goes here in the sky with the wings of the path of the absence of objective reference.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor pas thabs dang mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor pas thabs dang mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The yogin manifests the knowledge of the absence of objective reference with the means.

original: de rnams kyi ye shes ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ye shes ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: Their knowledge is the sky.

original: de las 'gro ba ni gnas te 'dir 'gro ba ni gnas pa'i don to ;
analyzed: de las 'gro ba ni gnas te 'dir 'gro ba ni gnas pa'i don to ;
translated: From that, the going is the abode, since here the meaning of going is the meaning of abode.

original: / de yang ngal sos te mi dmigs pa'i ye shes mngon du byas nas gzhan kun du spyod pa 'gags te /
analyzed: / de yang ngal sos te mi dmigs pa'i ye shes mngon du byas nas gzhan kun du spyod pa 'gags te /
translated: Moreover, having rested and manifested the non-apprehending gnosis, the other conduct is stopped.

original: 'di ni gzhan du spyod pa med pa'o //üîΩde'i ye shes ni shes rab ste shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan du spyod pa med pa'o // de'i ye shes ni shes rab ste shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro ma ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the absence of conduct elsewhere.üîΩIts gnosis is wisdom, since it is the nature of wisdom.

original: dra ba ni thabs te gang gi phyir dra bas nya la sogs pa sdom par grub po //
analyzed: dra ba ni thabs te gang gi phyir dra bas nya la sogs pa sdom par grub po //
translated: The dakini is emptiness, since the net is the method, since by the net, fish and so on are bound.

original: gang gi phyir thabs kyis nyon mongs pa'i nya la sogs pa nyid bsdams pas ci yang mi byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thabs kyis nyon mongs pa'i nya la sogs pa nyid bsdams pas ci yang mi byed de /
translated: Since by the method, the fish of the afflictions and so on are bound, nothing is done.üîΩThe binding of that is bliss, since having removed the faults, it binds.

original: de nyid kyi sdom pa ni bde ba ste kha na ma tho ba phyir bsal nas sdom par byed pas mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom mo //üîΩsham ni bde ba'i tshig nyid de //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sdom pa ni bde ba ste kha na ma tho ba phyir bsal nas sdom par byed pas mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom mo // sham ni bde ba'i tshig nyid de //
translated: The dakini's net binds.üîΩSham is the word for bliss.

original: sham ni bde bar @144b brjod pa bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sham ni bde bar @144b brjod pa bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sham is said to be bliss.

original: gang yang 'jig rten pa rnams ni sham gyi sgra ni rkan las byung bar 'dod do //
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten pa rnams ni sham gyi sgra ni rkan las byung bar 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, the worldly people assert that the sound of the letter ‚Äúa‚Äù arises from the palate.

original: yang na mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma la sogs pa rnams rang las sprul zhing 'chang bas na byings so //
analyzed: yang na mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma la sogs pa rnams rang las sprul zhing 'chang bas na byings so //
translated: Or, the root is that the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s, LƒÅmƒÅs, and so forth emanate and are held from oneself.

original: 'das ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang thabs phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas khyad bar du byed de khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du byas pa'i dpal he ru ka yang dag par sbyor ba bshad par bya zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'das ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang thabs phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas khyad bar du byed de khyad par gsum gyis khyad par du byas pa'i dpal he ru ka yang dag par sbyor ba bshad par bya zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The superlative is distinguished by three distinctions, and the glorious Heruka is distinguished by the perfect union.

original: 'dir ni su'i mtha' can dang ti'i mtha' can gyi tshig thams cad du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni su'i mtha' can dang ti'i mtha' can gyi tshig thams cad du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here, all words ending in ‚Äúsu‚Äù and ‚Äúti‚Äù should be explained.

original: mtshams sbyar ni dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ni dgongs pa ste /
translated: The connection is the intention.

original: thos ba dang bsam pa la sogs pa yang dang yang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: thos ba dang bsam pa la sogs pa yang dang yang du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the repeated performance of listening, reflection, and so forth.

original: rgol ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su byas nas rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su byas nas rgol ba'o //
translated: The objection is the objection made by taking the opposite side.

original: lan ni brgal pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni brgal pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: The reply is the complete abandonment of the objection.

original: gong du bstan pa gang 'og nas 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su rang gi blos dpyad cing go bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa gang 'og nas 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su rang gi blos dpyad cing go bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand and analyze with one's own mind the situation that is taught above and that will occur below.

original: 'di thams cad gang du gnas nas bdag gis bshad cas pa la gsang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad gang du gnas nas bdag gis bshad cas pa la gsang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, where is this all located? is said to be secret, etc.üîΩThe term secret refers to the thirty-seven yoginis, both those who are heroes and those who are not heroes, who are located in the five wheels that are renowned as the gnosis, mind, speech, body, and charnel ground mandalas.

original: gsang ba'i sgras ni ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku dang / dur khrod du grags pa'i 'khor lo lnga la gnas pa dpa' bo dang bcas pa dang / dpa' bo med pa'i rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun bzang po de la brten pas gsang ba ste rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis gnas su rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sgras ni ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku dang / dur khrod du grags pa'i 'khor lo lnga la gnas pa dpa' bo dang bcas pa dang / dpa' bo med pa'i rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun bzang po de la brten pas gsang ba ste rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis gnas su rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The excellent is the secret that is based on them, meaning that the yoginis are suitable to be located in the mandala.

original: yang gzhal yas khang pa'o //
analyzed: yang gzhal yas khang pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the immeasurable mansion.

original: 'dis ci zhig brjod ce na mchog ces gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig brjod ce na mchog ces gsungs te /
translated: What is expressed by this? Supreme, it is said.

original: mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The supreme is nirvana.

original: 'di ni gang ji srid pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas na mchog go //
analyzed: 'di ni gang ji srid pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas na mchog go //
translated: Since it is desired as the fruit of whatever exists, it is supreme.

original: yang na mchog ni dgra ste rgyu nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mchog ni dgra ste rgyu nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the supreme is the enemy, which is the cause, the afflictions.

original: de yang mchog ni spang zhing yongs su spang ste 'joms par byed pa yin pa de mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mchog ni spang zhing yongs su spang ste 'joms par byed pa yin pa de mchog ces bya'o //

original: dgyes pa ni 'dis rol ba ste sgyu ma lta bu ra so sor snang zhing gsal bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dgyes pa ni 'dis rol ba ste sgyu ma lta bu ra so sor snang zhing gsal bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúplay‚Äù is the enjoyment by this, because it is the appearance and manifestation of the illusion-like individual appearances.

original: 'di'i phyogs gcig yin pa nyid kyi phyir dgyes shing rol pa de mngon du byed pa la yang thams cad nas ma yin pa'i phyir nged ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di'i phyogs gcig yin pa nyid kyi phyir dgyes shing rol pa de mngon du byed pa la yang thams cad nas ma yin pa'i phyir nged ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because it is just one part of this, the ‚Äúplay‚Äù is manifested, and because it is not everything, it is said to be ‚Äúpartial,‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad ni brtan pa dang g-yo pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de thams cad bdag nyid de gzhal yas khang pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni brtan pa dang g-yo pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de thams cad bdag nyid de gzhal yas khang pa'o //
translated: Everything is the nature of the animate and inanimate, and so on. That everything is the nature of the celestial mansion.

original: de la gnas pa ni de las gzhan du 'gro ba ldog ste @145a * //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni de las gzhan du 'gro ba ldog ste @145a * //
translated: Abiding in that, one turns away from going elsewhere.

original: 'gro bar bya ba las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya ba las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is nothing other than what is to be gone.

original: rtag tu zhes pa ni 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar ro //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means for as long as sa·πÉsƒÅra lasts.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yod du zin kyang gnas phun sum tshogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yod du zin kyang gnas phun sum tshogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
translated: Even if there is an excellent place, it becomes not an excellent place.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
translated: The hero who is the nature of all dakinis,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: mkha' 'gro kun ni mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun ni mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: All dakinis are dakinis, lamas, and so forth.

original: de yan lag tu gyur pa'i lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir de'i yan lag dang nying lag nyid kyis bdag nyid chen po'o //
analyzed: de yan lag tu gyur pa'i lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir de'i yan lag dang nying lag nyid kyis bdag nyid chen po'o //
translated: Because he is the nature of the body mindfulness foundation and so forth, which are the limbs of that, he is the great being by being the limbs and secondary limbs of that.

original: yang na dbang po dang bcas par smras na tshig chad ma nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang po dang bcas par smras na tshig chad ma nyid du 'gyur ba'o //

original: mkha' 'gro kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor bstan to //

analyzed: gzhan gyi don mi byed pa ni ston pa po bdag nyid che ba ma yin no zhes pa la /

analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa la zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir sems dpa'o //

analyzed: de ltar gyi don yang gang gi yin par nges zhes pa la /

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes gsungs te dbyer mi phyed pa'i bsam pa ste / mi phyed pa la lhag bar mos //
translated: It is said Vajrasattva's, which means indivisible.

original: zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes dgongs so //
translated: It is thought: One should have firm conviction in the indivisible.

analyzed: don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang don rab tu bsgrub pa'i nus pa med do zhes pa la / bde ba zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: bde ba ni shin tu bde ba ste /

original: stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: don dam pa dang don dam pa ma yin pa gnyis la chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di yang bya ba'i khyad par yin no //

analyzed: dngos po med pa la lhag par mos pa ni mdzes pa ma yin zhes pa la /

original: mchog ces gsungs te /
analyzed: mchog ces gsungs te /
translated: supreme.

original: gzhan gyi don la dga' bas na mchog go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la dga' bas na mchog go //

analyzed: 'di ni bya ba'i khyad par yin pa de rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gnas la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid dpal he ru ka yang dag par sbyor ba bshad par bya zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag nyid dpal he ru ka yang dag par sbyor ba bshad par bya zhes sbyar ro //

analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te 'di ni nges par gzung ba'o //

original: rang byung zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang byung zhes gsungs te /

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'byung ba'i sa gzhi de yin no //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'byung ba'i sa gzhi de yin no //

original: de gang yin zhes pa la /
analyzed: de gang yin zhes pa la /

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is the Blessed One because he is endowed withüîΩmastery, good form, glory, fame, wisdom, and

analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //

analyzed: drug po 'di la ldan zhes bya //

analyzed: bcom pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //

original: bcom pa dang ldan pa nyid ji ltar zhes pa la /
analyzed: bcom pa dang ldan pa nyid ji ltar zhes pa la /

original: dpa' zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dpa' zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las rgyal bas na dpa' bo'o //
translated: He is the hero because he is victorious over the battle of the afflictions.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,üîΩhe is the Blessed One because he has destroyed

analyzed: nyon mongs la sogs bdud rnams ni / bzhi po bcom pas bcom ldan no //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud rnams bcom pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang / nyon mongs la sogs bdud 'joms pas //

analyzed: 'joms phyir bcom ldan zhes su brjod // de ltar nyon mongs pa cis bcom //
translated: He is called ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn‚Äù because of destroying.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /

original: mkha' 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says ‚Äú·∏çƒÅkinƒ´,‚Äù etc.

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni shes rab ste /
translated: The ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´ is wisdom,

analyzed: de yang chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin no //

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /

original: bdag tu lta ba spangs ba yis //

translated: I have summarized and explained that such is the perfect union of the glorious Heruka, surrounded by the retinue of all dakinis.

original: rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod do zhes kha cig zer te /
analyzed: rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod do zhes kha cig zer te /
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-arisen‚Äù means that some say that cause and effect have an intrinsic reality.

original: don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, cause and effect do not exist intrinsically.

original: re zhig da ltar ba 'di 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig da ltar ba 'di 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: First, the present does not arise as an effect,

original: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from arising from existence and nonexistence.

original: gang yang yod pa ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang yang yod pa ni mi skye ste /
translated: That which exists does not arise,

original: yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it exists.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: It is like a thing that is asserted to be a cause.

original: gal te dngos po yod pa yang skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod pa yang skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that an existent thing arises,

original: dngos po 'jig pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that a thing would not perish.

original: gal te 'jig par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you accept that it perishes,

original: sngon gyi dngos po nyams pa las sngon ma byung ba skye na /
analyzed: sngon gyi dngos po nyams pa las sngon ma byung ba skye na /
translated: then that which did not exist previously arises from the destruction of the previous thing.

original: dngos po yod pa las skye ba med pa dang / gal te sngon gyi dngos po nyams pa las sngon ma byung ba skye ba de lta na yang yod pa las skye ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa las skye ba med pa dang / gal te sngon gyi dngos po nyams pa las sngon ma byung ba skye ba de lta na yang yod pa las skye ba ste /
translated: If it is argued that a thing arises from a previous thing that has been destroyed, then also it arises from what exists,

original: sngon med pa dang lhan cig skye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngon med pa dang lhan cig skye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is non-existent before and arises simultaneously.

original: lhan cig tu skye ba ni med de sngon nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig tu skye ba ni med de sngon nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Simultaneous arising does not exist, because it has already been destroyed.

original: gang gi phyir sngon gyi dngos po nyams pa dang da ltar gyi dngos po yod pa'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba bskyed par mi nus pas kyang yod pa las skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon gyi dngos po nyams pa dang da ltar gyi dngos po yod pa'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba bskyed par mi nus pas kyang yod pa las skye ba med do //
translated: Because a previous thing has been destroyed and a present thing exists, it cannot produce what is similar to what did not exist before. Therefore, it does not arise from what exists.

original: gal te yod pa las skye bar mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yod pa las skye bar mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is argued that it is not accepted that it arises from what exists,

original: yod pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be existent?

original: gang gi phyir skye ba med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because a non-existent rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on do not exist.

original: don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po nyid yin no //
analyzed: don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po nyid yin no //
translated: It is a thing because it possesses the characteristic of being able to perform a function.

original: don gyi bya ba la sbyor mi nus pa'i phyir mi'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du don gyi bya ba don du gnyer bas rtag pa'i dngos po gang yang khas len par mi byed do //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba la sbyor mi nus pa'i phyir mi'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du don gyi bya ba don du gnyer bas rtag pa'i dngos po gang yang khas len par mi byed do //
translated: Because they are incapable of being applied to the activity of an object, like the horn of an human being, etc., they do not accept any permanent entity whatsoever, since they seek the activity of an object.

original: yang na yod pa skye ba yin par khas blangs su zin kyang de rnams las skye ba med de bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na yod pa skye ba yin par khas blangs su zin kyang de rnams las skye ba med de bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Or, even if one accepts that an existent is produced, it is not produced from those, because that has been refuted.

original: med pa yang mi skye ste 'og nas sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang mi skye ste 'og nas sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is a non-existent produced, because it will be refuted later.

original: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba med de phan tshun @146b spangs te gnas pas bdag nyid gcig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba med de phan tshun @146b spangs te gnas pas bdag nyid gcig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there production from an existent and non-existent, because they are mutually exclusive and do not have the same nature.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs la yang skye ba med de dus gcig tu yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs la yang skye ba med de dus gcig tu yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there production in the position of neither, because both existence and non-existence are refuted at the same time.

original: yod pa dang med pa las phyin ci log tu gyur pas yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir logs shig na mi srid do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las phyin ci log tu gyur pas yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir logs shig na mi srid do //
translated: Nor is it possible that there is production in a third position, because it is the opposite of existence and non-existence and does not have the nature of existence and non-existence.

original: de srid kyang mi rtag par 'dod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu nges par yod par thal bar 'gyur te 'bras bu yod pa la rtsod pa 'gog pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de srid kyang mi rtag par 'dod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu nges par yod par thal bar 'gyur te 'bras bu yod pa la rtsod pa 'gog pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But since they assert that it is impermanent, it follows that cause and effect would definitely exist, because this is the context of refuting the argument against the existence of the effect.

original: don gyi bya ba la sbyor ba med de yod pa las kyang skyer mi btub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba la sbyor ba med de yod pa las kyang skyer mi btub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no application to the activity of the object, because it cannot arise from an existent.

original: des thun mong du dngos po thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du med de skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: des thun mong du dngos po thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du med de skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In general, all things do not have the nature of being one or many, because arising has been refuted.

original: dngos po rang bzhin med par sgrub bzhin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dang ldan pas rtag tu dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin med par sgrub bzhin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dang ldan pas rtag tu dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since it is established that things are essenceless, they would always be nonexistent, since they would be devoid of arising.

original: 'dir lan gdab par bya ste /üîΩskye ba'i snga rol na yod pa gcig skye'am med pa gcig skye ;
analyzed: 'dir lan gdab par bya ste / skye ba'i snga rol na yod pa gcig skye'am med pa gcig skye ;
translated: Here, we respond:üîΩDoes that which exists prior to arising arise, or does that which does not exist arise?

original: gal te yod pa las skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa las skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that that which exists arises,

original: yod pa las skye ba ma yin te thams cad kyis gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du med de yod pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa las skye ba ma yin te thams cad kyis gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du med de yod pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not produced from an existent, because all things are not of the nature of one or many, since they are established as having the nature of existence.

original: med pa las kyang mi skye ste 'og nas 'gog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na nus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu'i bdag nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa bskyed do zhe na /
analyzed: med pa las kyang mi skye ste 'og nas 'gog pa'i phyir ro // yang na nus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu'i bdag nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa bskyed do zhe na /
translated: It is not produced from a nonexistent, because that will be refuted later.üîΩOr, if you say that the nature of the cause, which is the nature of potentiality, produces the nature of the effect, which is existence,

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa de yod pa zhig yin nam med pa zhig yin /
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa de yod pa zhig yin nam med pa zhig yin /
translated: is the nature of the effect, which is existence, produced as existent or as nonexistent?

original: gal te rgyus byas pa'i sngon rol du yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyus byas pa'i sngon rol du yod pa yin na /
translated: If it is existent prior to being produced by the cause,

original: nus pa bzhin du mi skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa bzhin du mi skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would not be produced, like potentiality.

original: gtan tshigs ni gong du song ba'i rim pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni gong du song ba'i rim pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: The reason is the same as the previous one.

original: / yang na med par 'dod na de'i tshe 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / yang na med par 'dod na de'i tshe 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if you assert that it is nonexistent, then the assertion that the effect exists would be undermined.

original: 'bras bu med par smra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par smra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the effect would be asserted to be nonexistent.

original: nus pa dang gsal ba gcig tu 'dod na /
analyzed: nus pa dang gsal ba gcig tu 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that potentiality and the effect are the same,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be the fault of the position of existence and non-existence.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid yin na sngon du bstan pa'i skyon nyid kyis so //üîΩgzhan yang nus pa 'di rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid yin na sngon du bstan pa'i skyon nyid kyis so // gzhan yang nus pa 'di rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: If they were different natures, the fault already explained would apply.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin /
translated: Moreover, is this potentiality the nature of the cause or the nature of the effect?

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: If it is the nature of the cause,

original: de nyid skye ba'i sngon rol du yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu ma yin pas 'bras bu yod par smras pa nyams so //
analyzed: de nyid skye ba'i sngon rol du yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu ma yin pas 'bras bu yod par smras pa nyams so //
translated: since it exists prior to the arising of that cause, it is not the effect, and so the assertion of the existence of the effect is undermined.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin na 'bras @147a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin na 'bras @147a * //
translated: If it is the nature of the effect,

original: bu'i dus na nus pa med do //
analyzed: bu'i dus na nus pa med do //
translated: at the time of the effect, it is not potentiality.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na sngon med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na sngon med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is its nature, how could it be non-existent prior to that?

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid la nus pa'i ngo bo nyid 'bras bu yod pa yin na nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid la nus pa'i ngo bo nyid 'bras bu yod pa yin na nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If the nature of potentiality is the nature of the cause, and the effect exists, it is not potentiality,

original: gsal ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because manifestation is impossible.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis las nus pa don gzhan du gyur pa yin na de nyid ma yin pa gnyis brjod du yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis las nus pa don gzhan du gyur pa yin na de nyid ma yin pa gnyis brjod du yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If potentiality is a different object from the two, cause and effect, it is not those two, and so it cannot be expressed.

original: nus pa ni rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin no //üîΩgal te rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin na /
analyzed: nus pa ni rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin no // gal te rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin na /
translated: Potency is neither a cause nor an effect.üîΩIf it is neither a cause nor an effect,

original: cung zad dgag pa dang sgrub pa med pas gnod pa med do //
analyzed: cung zad dgag pa dang sgrub pa med pas gnod pa med do //
translated: then it is not established as a separate entity, because it is not established as either a cause or an effect.

original: gzhan yang dngos por gyur pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu bkag pas grol bar 'dod pa bkag pa'i yul grub ste sems phyin ci ma log pa thar pa grub pa ni 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos por gyur pa thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu bkag pas grol bar 'dod pa bkag pa'i yul grub ste sems phyin ci ma log pa thar pa grub pa ni 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, the object of refutation is established, namely, the assertion that all things are liberated by the refutation of cause and effect, because it is accepted that the establishment of liberation is the nonerroneous mind.

original: nus pa dang ldan pa las ma gtogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa'i nus pa med de rang gi ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dmigs pa yin pa las bye brag tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa las ma gtogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa'i nus pa med de rang gi ngo bo bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dmigs pa yin pa las bye brag tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Apart from that which possesses potency, there is no other entity called potency, because, like a pot, etc., its own nature is not observed separately from that which is observed.

original: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tshogs pas nus pa yod pa de med na med pa la 'bras bu rnam par shes pas mig la sogs pa bzhin du yod par dgag cing sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tshogs pas nus pa yod pa de med na med pa la 'bras bu rnam par shes pas mig la sogs pa bzhin du yod par dgag cing sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Since it is the nature of non-apprehension, it is not possible to affirm or deny the existence of the eye, etc. by the effect, since it is not existent when it is not existent, like consciousness, the effect.

original: rtag pa nyid yin pas 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin pas 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is permanent, it is not possible to generate an effect.

original: de med pas dpe mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de med pas dpe mi 'grub po //
translated: Since it does not exist, the example is not established.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa yang thun mong gi rigs pa'i rim pa 'di yis sun phyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa yang thun mong gi rigs pa'i rim pa 'di yis sun phyung bar bya'o //
translated: The inexpressible in terms of sameness and difference is also refuted by this process of reasoning.

original: de bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa thams cad la yang go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa thams cad la yang go bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood for all hidden phenomena.

original: gal te skye ba'i dngos po bdag nyid yod pa yin na dngos po yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i dngos po bdag nyid yod pa yin na dngos po yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the entity of arising exists by itself, how could it be an existent entity?

original: gzhan yang skye ba med pa yod par rtogs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba med pa yod par rtogs na /
translated: Moreover, if non-arising exists,

original: de lta na ni skye ba'i sngon rol du skye ba med pa'i dngos po yod par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni skye ba'i sngon rol du skye ba med pa'i dngos po yod par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be taught that the entity of non-arising exists prior to arising.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po yod pa'i don du skye bar 'dod na gal te yang skye ba med par yod par grub na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po yod pa'i don du skye bar 'dod na gal te yang skye ba med par yod par grub na /
translated: If you assert that things arise in order to exist, then if they are established as existing without arising,

original: de'i tshe skye ba dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba dgos pa ci yod /
translated: at that time what is the purpose of arising?

original: skye ba med pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that things exist without arising,üîΩthat is not so, because the error already explained above applies to that.

original: ma yin te de la sngon du bstan pa'i skyon nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ma yin te de la sngon du bstan pa'i skyon nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this should be stated:

original: gal te skye ba'i sngon rol na yod pa yin la cha shas cung zad ma grub pas de'i don du skye ba don med pa ma yin no zhes pa'i phyogs la @147b yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i sngon rol na yod pa yin la cha shas cung zad ma grub pas de'i don du skye ba don med pa ma yin no zhes pa'i phyogs la @147b yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: If it exists prior to arising, but it is not established as even the slightest part, then arising is not purposeless.

original: de ni mi rigs te 'bras bu yod par smra bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te 'bras bu yod par smra bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not logical, because it follows that one would be advocating the existence of an effect.

original: yod pa dang med pa gcig tu mi btub pas yod pa'am med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gcig tu mi btub pas yod pa'am med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence and nonexistence cannot be the same, it follows that it would exist or it would not exist.

original: de la skyon yang bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la skyon yang bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In that regard, the error is also taught:

original: gsal ba'i phyogs ni sngon du sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyogs ni sngon du sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the position of manifestation has already been refuted.

original: gal te blangs par bya ba nyid du de bskyed par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blangs par bya ba nyid du de bskyed par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is generated in order to be taken up,

original: 'di'i phyogs kyang mi rigs te gang gi phyir dang po bdag nyid thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis skyes pa nyid du grub nas yod pa la /
analyzed: 'di'i phyogs kyang mi rigs te gang gi phyir dang po bdag nyid thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis skyes pa nyid du grub nas yod pa la /
translated: then this position is also incorrect, because if it is established as having arisen by its own intrinsic reality in the beginning,

original: de bzhin lan gnyis su bskyed pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin lan gnyis su bskyed pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is pointless to generate it a second time.

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i sngon rol bas kyang snga bar yod de sngon du bskyed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i sngon rol bas kyang snga bar yod de sngon du bskyed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since this is the context of the theory of realists, it exists prior to arising, because it is illogical to generate it prior to its existence.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyogs kyang sngon du sun phyung ba'i phyir thams cad du yod pa skye bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyogs kyang sngon du sun phyung ba'i phyir thams cad du yod pa skye bar mi rigs so //
translated: Since the position of nonarising was refuted earlier, it is illogical for everything to arise if it exists.

original: gal te yod pa skye ba med pas na med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod pa skye ba med pas na med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If what exists does not arise, then what does not exist arises.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du mer mer po la sogs pa'i rgyu la lan brgyad tsam du zin kyang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bzhin nyid lag tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus 'bras bur gyur pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa las ma dmigs pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du mer mer po la sogs pa'i rgyu la lan brgyad tsam du zin kyang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa bzhin nyid lag tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus 'bras bur gyur pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa las ma dmigs pa'i
translated: Because in the same way, even though the cause of the kalala, etc., is grasped as many as eight times, the body, which is the effect that has the nature of the collection of hands, feet, etc., is not observed as having the characteristic of being observed.

original: phyir med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyir med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du gzugs dang snang ba dang mig dang yid la byed pa rnams dang mdun na snang ba'i gzugs sngon po la sogs pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan no //üîΩrna ba dang sgra dang yid la byed pa rnams dang / gling bu dang pi wang la sogs pa dang / sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa brjod pa dang mi brjod pa yid du 'ongs ba dang mi 'ong ba'i sgra dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du gzugs dang snang ba dang mig dang yid la byed pa rnams dang mdun na snang ba'i gzugs sngon po la sogs pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan no // rna ba dang sgra dang yid la byed pa rnams dang / gling bu dang pi wang la sogs pa dang / sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa brjod pa dang mi brjod pa yid du 'ongs ba dang mi 'ong ba'i sgra dang bral ba ni /
translated: Because in the same way, the eye consciousness arises from the collection of causes consisting of form, light, eye, mental activity, and the blue, etc., form that appears in front.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The ear consciousness does not arise from the collection of causes consisting of sound, ear, mental activity, flute, lute, etc., and the pleasant and unpleasant sound that is expressed and unexpressed, such as blue, red, etc.

original: sna dang dri dang yid la byed pa rnams dang / tsam pa ka dang ba ku la la sogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang bar ma'i drir sna'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩlce dang ro dang yid la byed pa rnams dang / tsha ba dang kha ba dang bska ba la sogs pa ror snang ba ni lce'i rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sna dang dri dang yid la byed pa rnams dang / tsam pa ka dang ba ku la la sogs pa'i yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang bar ma'i drir sna'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no // lce dang ro dang yid la byed pa rnams dang / tsha ba dang kha ba dang bska ba la sogs pa ror snang ba ni lce'i rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The nose, smells, and mental activity, and the pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral smells of camphor, bakula flowers, and so on are not the nose consciousness.üîΩThe tongue, tastes, and mental activity, and the appearances of tastes such as bitter, sour, and astringent are not the tongue consciousness.

original: lus dang yid dang reg bya rnams dang 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa reg byar snang ba ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus dang yid dang reg bya rnams dang 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa reg byar snang ba ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The body, tactile objects, and mental activity, and the appearances of tactile objects such as smoothness and roughness are not the body consciousness.

original: 'das ma thag pa dang / mi gzhan yid la byed pa dang / sngon po la @148a * //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa dang / mi gzhan yid la byed pa dang / sngon po la @148a * //
translated: The immediately preceding [moment of consciousness], the mental activity of another person, and blue

original: sogs pa gzugs su snang ba ni rjes las thob pa'i shes pa 'di ni sngon po'o zhes rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gzugs kyi rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa gzugs sngon po la sogs pa'i yul la
analyzed: sogs pa gzugs su snang ba ni rjes las thob pa'i shes pa 'di ni sngon po'o zhes rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gzugs kyi rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa gzugs sngon po la sogs pa'i yul la
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the fact that the cognition that perceives blue is not a cognition that perceives the aspect of blue and so on, because the cognition that perceives blue is a conceptual cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚ÄùüîΩThe cognition that perceives blue does not exist.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the fact that the cognition that perceives blue is not a cognition that perceives the aspect of blue and so on, because the cognition that perceives blue is a conceptual cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚Äù

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that perceives blue does not exist.

original: de bzhin du drug po 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam shes gang yin pa de yid do zhes bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du drug po 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam shes gang yin pa de yid do zhes bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the fact that the cognition that perceives blue is not a cognition that perceives the aspect of blue and so on, because the cognition that perceives blue is a conceptual cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚ÄùüîΩThe cognition that perceives blue does not exist.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the fact that the cognition that perceives blue is not a cognition that perceives the aspect of blue and so on, because the cognition that perceives blue is a conceptual cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚ÄùüîΩThe cognition that perceives blue does not exist.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the fact that the cognition that perceives blue is not a cognition that perceives the aspect of blue and so on, because the cognition that perceives blue is a conceptual cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚ÄùüîΩThe cognition that perceives blue does not exist.

original: de bzhin du so sor skyed pa po sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya so sor snang ba ni rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang de ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni sgra la sogs pa dngos po med pa la 'di
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor skyed pa po sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya so sor snang ba ni rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang de ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni sgra la sogs pa dngos po med pa la 'di
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text refers to the fact that the cognition that perceives blue is not a cognition that perceives the aspect of blue and so on, because the cognition that perceives blue is a conceptual cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚Äù

original: yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sgra la sogs pa so sor snang ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sgra la sogs pa so sor snang ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The sound of nonconceptuality and so on appearing individually to a conceptual consciousness does not exist for an auditory consciousness and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa 'di yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du ste ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa 'di yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du ste ste /
translated: A conceptual consciousness is the entity of this blue and so on.

original: rgyu de la ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de la ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist in the cause.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yang mdun na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs so sor snang ba la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yang mdun na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs so sor snang ba la /
translated: Nonconceptuality is the individual appearance of the form of blue and so on that is present in front.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma snga ma las rgyu gcig gis bsdus pa'i phyi ma skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba ni mdun du gnas pa sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan dang gzhan yul du bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma snga ma las rgyu gcig gis bsdus pa'i phyi ma skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba ni mdun du gnas pa sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan dang gzhan yul du bya ste /
translated: The second moment arises from the previous consciousness as a single cause, and it arises as another and another object, such as the form of blue that is present in front.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa bskyed de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa bskyed de /
translated: It generates a conceptual consciousness.

original: de yang rgyu la yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu la yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It also does not exist in the cause.

original: de ltar yul gzhan la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yul gzhan la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to other objects.

original: gang la rigs mthun pa'i rgyud gcig gis mtshan nyid la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba yod pa dang / gang du rgyud gcig tu 'jug pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang la rigs mthun pa'i rgyud gcig gis mtshan nyid la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba yod pa dang / gang du rgyud gcig tu 'jug pa med pa yin la /
translated: It is that which has a different characteristic in a single continuum that is similar to it, and it is that in which there is no engagement in a single continuum.

original: de yang rnam pa thams cad du gcig tu rgyun mi chad pa med pas gzhan yang rgyud nye bar gyur pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dbang po'i shes pa sgra la sogs pa'i yul tshogs pa thun mong sngon sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtogüîΩpa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i shes pa la /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa thams cad du gcig tu rgyun mi chad pa med pas gzhan yang rgyud nye bar gyur pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dbang po'i shes pa sgra la sogs pa'i yul tshogs pa thun mong sngon sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i shes pa la /
translated: Moreover, since there is no uninterrupted single continuum in any way, another continuum arises from a nonconceptual sense consciousness that is proximate to the continuum.

original: rjes su rtog pa med pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa yang de'i yul skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su rtog pa med pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa yang de'i yul skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A conceptual consciousness that is not a memory and that is associated with conception arises in regard to the object of that nonconceptual sense consciousness, such as a sound.

original: rgyu de la de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de la de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not the case for that cause.

original: khar ba'i dril bu'i sgra ji bzhin dang / chu'i gnyer ma bzhin du sgra'i rgyun la 'jug par 'dod do //
analyzed: khar ba'i dril bu'i sgra ji bzhin dang / chu'i gnyer ma bzhin du sgra'i rgyun la 'jug par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that it engages the continuum of sound, like the sound of a bronze gong and like the waves of a river.

original: de'i 'dod pas sngon gyi sgra'i rnga skad cig @148b 'dzin pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mi rtog pas phyis sgra'i skad cig mi 'dzin pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa med pa'am /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pas sngon gyi sgra'i rnga skad cig @148b 'dzin pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mi rtog pas phyis sgra'i skad cig mi 'dzin pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa med pa'am /
translated: Because of that desire, the ear consciousness that apprehends the sound of a drum in the past is non-conceptual, and the ear consciousness that apprehends the sound of a drum in the future is also non-conceptual.

original: gzhan yang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sgra'i mdun nam gzhan yul can gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sgra'i mdun nam gzhan yul can gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, a conceptual consciousness of sound arises either before or after the object-possessor.

original: 'chad pa'i dus su yang snga ma snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa las phyi ma phyi ma'i rnam par rtog pa sems la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'chad pa'i dus su yang snga ma snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa las phyi ma phyi ma'i rnam par rtog pa sems la 'byung ngo //
translated: Even at the time of explanation, later conceptual thoughts arise in the mind from earlier conceptual thoughts.

original: 'o na dang po nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rtog bcas gzhan skyed byed de gang las skyes she na /
analyzed: 'o na dang po nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa rtog bcas gzhan skyed byed de gang las skyes she na /
translated: If so, then the first conceptual thought that produces another conceptual thought arises from what?

original: 'di la ni nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la ni nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty in this.

original: kha cig tu dga' ba dbang po'i shes pa gcig las sam mang po las kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig tu dga' ba dbang po'i shes pa gcig las sam mang po las kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In some cases, it arises from one sense consciousness of pleasure, or even from many.

original: ji ltar gnyid 'thug pos non pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyid 'thug pos non pa la /
translated: Just as when one is overcome by deep sleep,

original: glo bur du dbyug pa lhung bas de dang phrad pa'i reg bya'i yul la /
analyzed: glo bur du dbyug pa lhung bas de dang phrad pa'i reg bya'i yul la /
translated: Suddenly, the stick falls and the tactile object is encountered.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i shes pa byung ba ni skyes bu la lus kyi dbang po'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i shes pa byung ba ni skyes bu la lus kyi dbang po'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: The tactile consciousness of the body arises.

original: kha cig tu thog chen po lhung ba las rtog pa med pa las rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu thog chen po lhung ba las rtog pa med pa las rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: In some cases, a great thunderbolt falls and the auditory consciousness arises from the non-conceptual.

original: kha cig tu aa ga ru dang tsandan dang / ga pur la sogs pa byugs shing zos pas sna'i bu ga rgyas te /
analyzed: kha cig tu aa ga ru dang tsandan dang / ga pur la sogs pa byugs shing zos pas sna'i bu ga rgyas te /
translated: In some cases, by anointing and consuming agarwood, sandalwood, camphor, and so on, the nasal cavity expands.

original: sna'i dbang pos shes pa dri'i yul spyod do //
analyzed: sna'i dbang pos shes pa dri'i yul spyod do //
translated: The nose consciousness experiences the object of smell.

original: kha cig tu tsha ba dang kha ba dang bska ba la sogs pa'i rdzas lce dang phrad pa'i lce'i dbang po shes pa mi rtog pa yul ro la skye ba yin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu tsha ba dang kha ba dang bska ba la sogs pa'i rdzas lce dang phrad pa'i lce'i dbang po shes pa mi rtog pa yul ro la skye ba yin no //
translated: In some cases, by the tongue consciousness encountering hot, sour, astringent, and other substances, the non-conceptual tongue consciousness arises in the object of taste.

original: kha cig tu reg bya shes pa'i rjes la mig phye bas bla ma la sogs pa'i skye bo'i yul gzugs mthong bas ni mig gi dbang po'i shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu reg bya shes pa'i rjes la mig phye bas bla ma la sogs pa'i skye bo'i yul gzugs mthong bas ni mig gi dbang po'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: In some cases, after the tactile consciousness, by opening the eyes and seeing the object of form of a guru and other beings, the eye consciousness arises.

original: kha cig tu dbang po'i shes pa thams cad nub nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gtso bo yid la sogs pa shes pa sdun  ma las rjes su byed pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa las kyang rtog pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa skyes so
analyzed: kha cig tu dbang po'i shes pa thams cad nub nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gtso bo yid la sogs pa shes pa sdun  ma las rjes su byed pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa las kyang rtog pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa skyes so
translated: In some places, when all the sense consciousnesses have disappeared, the conceptual consciousnesses that are the principal mental consciousnesses and so on arise from the preceding conceptual consciousnesses.

original: // de nyid dus gcig tu dbang po'i shes pa lnga'am drug las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // de nyid dus gcig tu dbang po'i shes pa lnga'am drug las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They arise simultaneously with the five or six sense consciousnesses.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa drug gi rjes su gnyid kyis log pa'i dus su sngon du bsam pa'i don rmi lam na brjod par snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa drug gi rjes su gnyid kyis log pa'i dus su sngon du bsam pa'i don rmi lam na brjod par snang ngo //
translated: Just as in a dream state, after the six consciousnesses have ceased, the meaning of what was previously thought appears to be spoken.

original: gal te zhe na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pa las skye na /
analyzed: gal te zhe na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pa las skye na /
translated: If it is argued that it arises from what does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit,

original: thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it follows that everything would arise from everything.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba'i bskyed bu skyed byed la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba'i bskyed bu skyed byed la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Because the creator of the world and so on are like an illusion.

original: 'o na dbang @149a * //
analyzed: 'o na dbang @149a * //
translated: Well then, what is the difference between the two?

original: po'i shes pa rtog pa med pa yin la rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin par ji ltar shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: po'i shes pa rtog pa med pa yin la rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin par ji ltar shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one know that the consciousness of the object is non-conceptual and not conceptual?

original: 'di la re zhig phyi rol gyi don yod pa mdo sde bar gnas pa'i phyogs la byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar dran pa phyogs tsam cung zad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la re zhig phyi rol gyi don yod pa mdo sde bar gnas pa'i phyogs la byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar dran pa phyogs tsam cung zad brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, first, in order to make the position of the SautrƒÅntika who maintains the existence of external objects understood by the childish, I will briefly mention a little of what is remembered.

original: de la dngos po ni shes pa dang shes bya gnyis su gnas so //
analyzed: de la dngos po ni shes pa dang shes bya gnyis su gnas so //
translated: Therein, entities are of two kinds: consciousness and the object of consciousness.

original: gzhan gsum po la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gsum po la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The other three, etc., do not exist.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa la sogs pa yang de nyid kyi khongs su bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa la sogs pa yang de nyid kyi khongs su bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the agent, action, etc. are also included in those two.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rtog pa'ang tshad ma shes pa sngon du 'gro bas brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rtog pa'ang tshad ma shes pa sngon du 'gro bas brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in the same way, conceptualization should also be investigated as preceded by the knowledge of valid cognition,

original: tshig gi don rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad ma nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don rnam par gzhag pa ni tshad ma nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the establishment of the meaning of words is connected with valid cognition itself.

original: gzhan du na 'di lta bu'i gzugs 'di na med ces pa dang / 'di ni 'di na med do zhes pa'i yul gzhan dang dus gzhan dang / rang bzhin gzhan phan tshun spangs pas yul gzhan la sogs pa rtog pa med do //
