analyzed: gzhan du na 'di lta bu'i gzugs 'di na med ces pa dang / 'di ni 'di na med do zhes pa'i yul gzhan dang dus gzhan dang / rang bzhin gzhan phan tshun spangs pas yul gzhan la sogs pa rtog pa med do //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no such concepts as ‚ÄúThis form is not here,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is not here,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThat is there,‚Äù which are based on different places, times, and natures, since they are mutually exclusive.

original: gnyid 'thug po'i gnas skabs bzhin du sngon nyid las phan pa thob pa dang / mi phan pa spong ba'i bdag nyid tha snyad 'gro ba rnams la med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid 'thug po'i gnas skabs bzhin du sngon nyid las phan pa thob pa dang / mi phan pa spong ba'i bdag nyid tha snyad 'gro ba rnams la med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And, like the state of deep sleep, there would be no conventional usage of the terms ‚Äúbeneficial‚Äù and ‚Äúharmful‚Äù for the sake of obtaining benefit and avoiding harm.

original: gang yang yul dang dus kyi bskal pa de yang de'i yul dang dus rnams ni de nyid kyi dus na shes bya dang shes byed kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang yul dang dus kyi bskal pa de yang de'i yul dang dus rnams ni de nyid kyi dus na shes bya dang shes byed kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: As for the distinction of place and time, that place and time are the nature of the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: rang bzhin gyi bskal pa gang yin pa yang don gyi bya ba byed ba de thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa yang shes bya'i tshogs su gnas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bskal pa gang yin pa yang don gyi bya ba byed ba de thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa yang shes bya'i tshogs su gnas so //
translated: As for the distinction of nature, all the activities of the object are included in the totality of objects of knowledge, such as omniscience, freedom from attachment, and so on.

original: gang yang don gyi bya ba mi byed pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du yang phyi rol la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang don gyi bya ba mi byed pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du yang phyi rol la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: And that which does not perform the function of an object does not exist externally, like the horns of an ass.

original: thog ma med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags 'ba' zhig las gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pas byas pa'i shes bya ni don dam pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags 'ba' zhig las gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pas byas pa'i shes bya ni don dam pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The object of knowledge that is created by the conceptualization that arises from the mere latent impressions of beginningless conceptualization is not ultimate.

original: dngos po ni gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni gnyis kho na ste /
translated: There are only two kinds of entities:

original: de la shes pa dang shes bya gnyis bdag nyid gcig pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de la shes pa dang shes bya gnyis bdag nyid gcig pa nyid med do //
translated: There is no identity between consciousness and the object of consciousness.

original: de'i bdag nyid gcig pa yin na shes pa nyid dam shes bya nyid gnyis su dbyer med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid gcig pa yin na shes pa nyid dam shes bya nyid gnyis su dbyer med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were identity, then consciousness and the object of consciousness would be undifferentiated.

original: de yang ma yin te gnyis po ni phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te gnyis po ni phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because the two are mutually dependent.

original: shes bya'i phyogs yin na ni 'gro ba rnams long ba dang lkugs pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i phyogs yin na ni 'gro ba rnams long ba dang lkugs pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object of consciousness were consciousness, then the world would be blind and dumb.

original: shes pa las gzhan med na shes @149b pa'i phyogs la shes bya nyid shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don mthong ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa las gzhan med na shes @149b pa'i phyogs la shes bya nyid shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don mthong ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is nothing other than consciousness, then because the object of cognition is itself cognition, there would be no seeing of external objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod par smra bas de lta bu de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod par smra bas de lta bu de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But the proponents of external objects do not accept that.

original: de la gnyis po phan tshun spangs te gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gnyis po phan tshun spangs te gnas pa yin te /
translated: In that regard, the two are mutually exclusive.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid shes bya'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid shes bya'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of consciousness is not the nature of the object of cognition.

original: shes pa nyid gzhan gyis gsal bar byed pa ma yin la rang nyid gsal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid gzhan gyis gsal bar byed pa ma yin la rang nyid gsal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not illuminated by another, but it illuminates itself,

original: shes bya gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the nature of the object of cognition to illuminate.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na sngar bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na sngar bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were that nature, the previously explained error would follow.

original: shes pa yang gsal ba nyid ma yin na shes bya'i bdag nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa yang gsal ba nyid ma yin na shes bya'i bdag nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If consciousness is not illumination, the error of the object of cognition being its nature would follow.

original: gzhan gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gsal ba yin na /
translated: If it is illuminated by another,

original: gzhan yang de bas lhag ba'i gsal byed nyid yin no //üîΩgzhan yang rang gsal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bas lhag ba'i gsal byed nyid yin no // gzhan yang rang gsal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Moreover, it would be the illuminator of that.üîΩMoreover, it would be self-illuminating,

original: gzhan gyi gsal byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gsal byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would be the illuminator of another.

original: gzhan du na gzhan 'dis gsal byed yin zhes bya bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan 'dis gsal byed yin zhes bya bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be the illuminator of that,

original: 'di yang gsal ba yin zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang gsal ba yin zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and that would not be the illuminated.

original: rang nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be the nature of self-illumination,

original: de gsal bar ma gzung yang gsal byed nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsal bar ma gzung yang gsal byed nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it is not grasped as illuminated, it is the illuminator.

original: gzhan du na sgrub par mi nus te de'i gsal bar byed pa nyid rtogs par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na sgrub par mi nus te de'i gsal bar byed pa nyid rtogs par dka' ba yin te /
translated: Otherwise, it cannot be established that it is the illuminator, because it is difficult to understand its nature as the illuminator.

original: gsal byed ma bzung bas ni gsal byed nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal byed ma bzung bas ni gsal byed nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the illuminator is not grasped, it cannot be established as the illuminator.

original: gang gi phyir gsal byed nyid du bzung ba ni gsal ba nyid du rtogs kyi gzhan du ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal byed nyid du bzung ba ni gsal ba nyid du rtogs kyi gzhan du ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: Because when it is grasped as the illuminator, it is understood as the illuminated, but not otherwise.

original: de rtogs pa yang gsal byed nyid kyis rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang gsal byed nyid kyis rtogs pa yin na /
translated: And if its understanding is by the illuminator,

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be the fault of mutual dependence.

original: 'o na gang gi phyir yang dngos po'i rang bzhin yin te de'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan nye bar bsgyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi phyir yang dngos po'i rang bzhin yin te de'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan nye bar bsgyur te /
translated: But why is it the nature of things? Its nature transforms others.

original: ji ltar dmar po'i rdzas dang sbyar bas dkar po'i rdzas kyang dmar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar dmar po'i rdzas dang sbyar bas dkar po'i rdzas kyang dmar por 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, a substance that is red causes a substance that is white to become red.

original: de ltar nag po'i rdzas kyis nag por 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar nag po'i rdzas kyis nag por 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, a substance that is black causes a substance that is white to become black.

original: ljang gus ljang gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ljang gus ljang gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: A substance that is green causes a substance that is white to become green.

original: mar me'i 'od kyis kyang gsal bar byed de snang ba dang bcas pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od kyis kyang gsal bar byed de snang ba dang bcas pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The light of a lamp causes a form that is not illuminated to become illuminated.

original: gang yang rang nyid gsal byed kyi bdag nyid ma yin na de bdag nyid dang gzhan mi gsal ba ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /üîΩgang gi phyir dbyig @150a * //üîΩpa'i mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis mun pa'i bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang rang nyid gsal byed kyi bdag nyid ma yin na de bdag nyid dang gzhan mi gsal ba ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur / gang gi phyir dbyig @150a * // pa'i mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis mun pa'i bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if a lamp does not have the nature of illuminating itself, how could it illuminate that which is not of the nature of illuminating itself?üîΩFor example, a lamp that does not have the nature of illuminating itself does not illuminate a pot that is in the dark.

original: mar me la sogs pa len pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa len pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, it follows that a lamp would not grasp itself.

original: gal te gzhan gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid blangs pas gzhan gsal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid blangs pas gzhan gsal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it illuminates another because it takes on the nature of illumination,

original: de ni ma yin te gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not so, because it does not possess the nature of illumination.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du gang gzhan ma yin pa de la re zhig rang gi ngo bo nyid gsal byed ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan ji ltar gsal bar byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du gang gzhan ma yin pa de la re zhig rang gi ngo bo nyid gsal byed ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan ji ltar gsal bar byed /
translated: Because it is not like that, how could it illuminate another, since it does not illuminate itself?

original: de gzhan gyis gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de yang gzhan gyis byed dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzhan gyis gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de yang gzhan gyis byed dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the nature of illumination of another, then that would have to be produced by another, and so on ad infinitum.

original: cung zad kyang gsal bya dang gsal byed med pas 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cung zad kyang gsal bya dang gsal byed med pas 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no illumination or that which is illuminated, the world would be blind and dumb.

original: de yang gang 'di nyid dang 'di nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha snyad med pas tha snyad thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gang 'di nyid dang 'di nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa yul dang dus dang rang bzhin sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha snyad med pas tha snyad thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since there would be no conventions that have the nature of affirmation or negation in terms of place, time, and nature, such as this and that, all conventions would be severed.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: des ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun phyung ba'o //
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun phyung ba'o //
translated: This is the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa rang nyid gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa rang nyid gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: Since consciousness is by nature self-illuminating,

original: de lta na yang de'i shes bya ji ltar gsal bar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i shes bya ji ltar gsal bar byed par 'gyur /
translated: how can it illuminate its object?

original: gang gi phyir shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shes bya mi 'dzin la shes bya rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang shes pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shes bya mi 'dzin la shes bya rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang shes pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of consciousness does not apprehend the object, and the nature of the object does not apprehend consciousness.

original: de gnyis shin tu tha dad par ni gong du bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de gnyis shin tu tha dad par ni gong du bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has been proven above that these two are utterly different.

original: gal te shin tu tha dad pa yin du zin kyang dmar po'i rdzas dang dkar po'i rdzas sbyar bas dmar por 'gyur ba bzhin dang / mun par gnas pa'i snam bu la sogs pa sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'od gsal ba'i dngos po dang nye ba las gsal ba de bzhin du shes pa dang nye ba las shes bya gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shin tu tha dad pa yin du zin kyang dmar po'i rdzas dang dkar po'i rdzas sbyar bas dmar por 'gyur ba bzhin dang / mun par gnas pa'i snam bu la sogs pa sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'od gsal ba'i dngos po dang nye ba las gsal ba de bzhin du shes pa dang nye ba las shes bya gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But even if they are utterly different, just as when the substance of red and the substance of white are combined, the result is red, and just as when a cloth that is in the dark is brought near a lamp, the cloth becomes illuminated, in the same way, the object is illuminated by the consciousness.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not like that.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag shin tu tha dad pa'i dpe mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag shin tu tha dad pa'i dpe mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the example does not establish that consciousness and the object of consciousness are utterly different.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dpe zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i bdag nyid yin la shes pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dpe zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i bdag nyid yin la shes pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, the so-called example is the nature of the object of consciousness, but it is not the nature of consciousness.

original: de gnyis ni shin tu tha dad pas shes pa'i bdag nyid ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid du snang ba bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: de gnyis ni shin tu tha dad pas shes pa'i bdag nyid ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid du snang ba bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Since those two are utterly different, the nature of consciousness is not like the nature of the appearance.

original: de'i bdag nyid med @150b pa'i rang bzhin ni dpe yin la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid med @150b pa'i rang bzhin ni dpe yin la /
translated: The nature that does not have that nature is the example.

original: gang yang dper 'gyur ba ni gang gi phyir tshad mas grub pa'i don ni dper grub pa yin pa la de yang tshad ma las tha dad pas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang dper 'gyur ba ni gang gi phyir tshad mas grub pa'i don ni dper grub pa yin pa la de yang tshad ma las tha dad pas gnas pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, that which becomes the example is established as the object that is established by valid knowledge. Since that is different from valid knowledge, it is established.

original: de gsal bzhin pas de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ji ltar gsal bar byed /
analyzed: de gsal bzhin pas de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ji ltar gsal bar byed /
translated: How could the nature of the appearance that is not the nature of that be made manifest?

original: de ltar dpe grub pa med pas 'dod pa'i don cung zad kyang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar dpe grub pa med pas 'dod pa'i don cung zad kyang mi 'grub bo //
translated: Since the example is not established in that way, not even the slightest intended meaning is established.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'on pa dang lkugs pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'on pa dang lkugs pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All transmigrating beings would become deaf, mute, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar shes pa skyes pa'am ma skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar shes pa skyes pa'am ma skyes pa yin na /
translated: Because, whether the cognition has arisen or not,

original: skyes pa'i phyogs la gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyu yod pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyogs la gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyu yod pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: if it has arisen, it would be from the existence of the cause of form, etc.

original: de yang med na mi 'gyur te rnam pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: de yang med na mi 'gyur te rnam pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: But if that does not exist, it would not be, and it would have an aspect,

original: rnam pa med pa'am gzhan gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'am gzhan gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would be without an aspect, or it would have the aspect of another.

original: de la dang po'i phyogs la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba gnyi ga'i 'brel pa ni shes bya dang shes pa dag la med do //
analyzed: de la dang po'i phyogs la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba gnyi ga'i 'brel pa ni shes bya dang shes pa dag la med do //
translated: In the first case, neither the connection of identity nor the connection of origination exists for the object of cognition and the cognition.

original: tha dad pa'i shes bya gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis ji ltar rtog par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i shes bya gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis ji ltar rtog par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How could a distinct object of cognition be cognized by the nature of clarity? It could not!

original: de ltar shes bya las skyes ba med pas shes pa de'i rnam pa can med do //
analyzed: de ltar shes bya las skyes ba med pas shes pa de'i rnam pa can med do //
translated: Thus, since it does not arise from the object of cognition, the cognition does not have the aspect of that.

original: shes pa de'i rnam pa can du rtogs pa med pas kyang don rtogs pa ni btags pa tsam du grub kyi thams cad du don rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: shes pa de'i rnam pa can du rtogs pa med pas kyang don rtogs pa ni btags pa tsam du grub kyi thams cad du don rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: Since there is no cognition that has the aspect of that, the realization of the object is established as mere imputation. In all cases, the realization of the object does not exist.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pa'i phyir dang tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir de'i rnam pa dang bral bas sngon bzhin du den bsgrub pa'i yan lag nyid du bsam par mi
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pa'i phyir dang tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir de'i rnam pa dang bral bas sngon bzhin du den bsgrub pa'i yan lag nyid du bsam par mi
translated: Because there is no identity or origination from the position of permanence, impermanence, existence, or nonexistence, and because of being different, it is not to be considered as a means of establishing that, as before, by being free from its aspects.

original: bya'o // de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pas 'brel pa gzhan yang brtag par mi rigs te de ni nye bar phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya'o // de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pas 'brel pa gzhan yang brtag par mi rigs te de ni nye bar phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no identity or origination, it is also unreasonable to investigate another connection, because that is for the purpose of benefitting.

original: phan mi 'dogs na ni sngar bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs na ni sngar bstan pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no benefit, the previously explained fault would follow.

original: phan 'dogs na de las byung ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te phyis dpyad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs na de las byung ba'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur te phyis dpyad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is benefit, it would follow that it originates from that, because it is to be analyzed later.

original: thams cad du skya ba med pa'i phyogs ni gzhan sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du skya ba med pa'i phyogs ni gzhan sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The position of non-origination in all cases is not a means of establishing the other.

original: de ma yin pa'i phyogs ni de las byung ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i phyogs ni de las byung ba'i phyogs so //
translated: The position that is not that is the position that originates from that.

original: de la gcig tu phyi rol gyi don gyis bskyed pa ma yin no //üîΩshes pa nyid don gyi rnam par snang ba yin gyi logs shig pa'i @151a * //
analyzed: de la gcig tu phyi rol gyi don gyis bskyed pa ma yin no // shes pa nyid don gyi rnam par snang ba yin gyi logs shig pa'i @151a * //
translated: It is not produced by external objects alone.

original: don gyis bskyed pa ma yin no //üîΩthog ma med pa nas rnam par shes pa'i rgyud las byung ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du rnam par shes par smra bas kyang de bzhin du gang gi phyir sgo bcad nas khyim du nyal te /
analyzed: don gyis bskyed pa ma yin no // thog ma med pa nas rnam par shes pa'i rgyud las byung ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du rnam par shes par smra bas kyang de bzhin du gang gi phyir sgo bcad nas khyim du nyal te /
translated: Consciousness itself appears in the aspect of an object, but it is not produced by an object that is separate from it.üîΩLike a dream consciousness, it arises from the continuum of consciousness that has been evolving since beginningless time, due to the immediately preceding condition.

original: mig btsums te gnyid log pa las khang pa bas che ba'i tshad kyis glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa glang po che la sogs pa med par yang don gyi rnam pa skye'o //
analyzed: mig btsums te gnyid log pa las khang pa bas che ba'i tshad kyis glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa glang po che la sogs pa med par yang don gyi rnam pa skye'o //
translated: The Proponents of Consciousness say that when one is lying in bed at night, with the doors to the house sealed, and one falls asleep and dreams of elephants, horses, and so on, even though there are no elephants and so on, the consciousness arises in the aspect of an object.

original: de rmi lam na shes pa'i rnam pa snang ba yin gyi don rta la sogs pas byas pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de rmi lam na shes pa'i rnam pa snang ba yin gyi don rta la sogs pas byas pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: The appearance in the dream is an appearance of aspects of consciousness, not created by objects such as elephants.

original: mig gi bya ba med kyang so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi bya ba med kyang so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is illogical for objects such as elephants to create it, because even though there is no activity of the eyes, the objects appear distinctly.

original: gang gi phyir mig 'dzums pa yang long ba bzhin du gzugs so sor snang ba yod pa ma yin no //üîΩga la te mig gi bya ba yang de la nya bar dmigs pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig 'dzums pa yang long ba bzhin du gzugs so sor snang ba yod pa ma yin no // ga la te mig gi bya ba yang de la nya bar dmigs pa yod do zhe na /
translated: Because, when the eyes are closed, the visual consciousness does not appear, as it does for the blind.üîΩBut, it will be said, the activity of the eye is perceived in the case of the sleeping person.

original: bden te de la nya bar dmigs pa yod do //
analyzed: bden te de la nya bar dmigs pa yod do //
translated: True, the activity of the eye is perceived in the case of the sleeping person.

original: de la nye bar dmigs pa med par ni mi grub po //
analyzed: de la nye bar dmigs pa med par ni mi grub po //
translated: But it is not established that the visual consciousness is perceived in the case of the sleeping person.

original: 'on kyang mig gi dbang po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mig gi dbang po med pa nyid do //
translated: It is only the eye sense-faculty that is perceived.

original: long ba dang gnyid log pa la de med kyang rmi lam na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: long ba dang gnyid log pa la de med kyang rmi lam na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: For the blind and the sleeping person, there is no visual consciousness, even though there is a dream of blue, etc.

original: so sor snang ba ji ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor snang ba ji ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How could it be otherwise?

original: shi bar snang ba yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te rmi lam mam sad pa'i dus na yang med de de'i lus ni mes bsregs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: shi bar snang ba yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te rmi lam mam sad pa'i dus na yang med de de'i lus ni mes bsregs pa nyid yin no //
translated: And how could the dead person not be without visual consciousness, since there is no dream, whether of the sleeping or the waking state, and since his body is burned by fire?

original: ji ltar khang pa chung du'i nang du tshad shin tu che ba'i sa gzhi la gnas pa'i sdong po dang ri dang mtsho dang nam mkha'i dkyil du nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan so sor snang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khang pa chung du'i nang du tshad shin tu che ba'i sa gzhi la gnas pa'i sdong po dang ri dang mtsho dang nam mkha'i dkyil du nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan so sor snang ste /
translated: Just as in a small room, images of trees, mountains, lakes, and the sun in the sky appear in the ground which is very extensive, and each one appears there.

original: de rnams der zhugs pa'am gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams der zhugs pa'am gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not enter there or abide there.

original: gnyid log pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan la snang ba med do //
analyzed: gnyid log pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan la snang ba med do //
translated: They appear nowhere else except in sleep.

original: nyams pa med pa'i skyes bu thams cad la nye bar dmigs pa'i rgyus thun mong du don gyi ngo bo nyid de ltar nye bar dmigs so //
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i skyes bu thams cad la nye bar dmigs pa'i rgyus thun mong du don gyi ngo bo nyid de ltar nye bar dmigs so //
translated: The nature of the object is perceived in that way by all men who are not asleep, because of the commonality of the cause of perception.

original: gal te rmi lam na don yod pa yin na mkhan po la sogs pas bshad pa la sogs pa byed pa de ji ltar dmigs par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam na don yod pa yin na mkhan po la sogs pas bshad pa la sogs pa byed pa de ji ltar dmigs par mi 'gyur //
translated: If the object exists in a dream, how is it that the object is not perceived by the teacher and so on, who are present there?

original: gal te gnyid sad ba'i dus su dris pa la de thams cad med de mi dran pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gnyid sad ba'i dus su dris pa la de thams cad med de mi dran pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is not perceived because it does not exist at the time of waking, that is not so.

original: thams cad du mi dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du mi dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that it is not remembered at all.

original: gal te rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na don med na /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na don med na /
translated: If, in the state of dreaming, the object does not exist,

original: ci 'dod dpe tsam gyis gnyid sad pa'i dus su @151b don gyis stong pa'i shes pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci 'dod dpe tsam gyis gnyid sad pa'i dus su @151b don gyis stong pa'i shes pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: then, by mere analogy, at the time of waking, consciousness devoid of object would be established.

original: gang gi phyir rab rib can gyi shes pa log pa yin pa bzhin du rab rib med pa'i shes pa log par 'gyur ram ste mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab rib can gyi shes pa log pa yin pa bzhin du rab rib med pa'i shes pa log par 'gyur ram ste mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But, just as the consciousness of one with diseased vision is erroneous, is the consciousness of one without diseased vision erroneous? No, it is not.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa med pa de don gyis stong pa yang ma yin te mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa med pa de don gyis stong pa yang ma yin te mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in the same way, nonerroneous consciousness is not devoid of object, because it is nondeceptive.

original: don las skyes pa'i phyir slu'o //
analyzed: don las skyes pa'i phyir slu'o //
translated: It is deceptive because it arises from an object.

original: gzhan du shes pa don med pas 'byung na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang don mi rnyed de log pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du shes pa don med pas 'byung na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang don mi rnyed de log pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arose from something else, then, because consciousness would be devoid of object, it would not find the object even by the characteristic of nondeceptiveness, and it would be like a mistaken consciousness.

original: de yang don las skyes pa ni don rjes su 'gro pa dang ldog pa gnyis dngos su dbang po'i shes pa la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang don las skyes pa ni don rjes su 'gro pa dang ldog pa gnyis dngos su dbang po'i shes pa la yod pa yin no //
translated: And that which arises from an object is the presence of the object in the sense of the two, positive and negative concomitance, in the sense faculty consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i mig yod na shes pa yod la shes pa med na med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i mig yod na shes pa yod la shes pa med na med do //
translated: Because when the eye is free from defects such as cataracts, consciousness exists, and when it does not exist, consciousness does not exist.

original: mig 'dzums pa las gzugs dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa yod kyang de med na med do //
analyzed: mig 'dzums pa las gzugs dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa yod kyang de med na med do //
translated: Even when form, light, and mental activity exist, if the eye is closed, consciousness does not exist.

original: yang mig phye nas yod pa yin no /
analyzed: yang mig phye nas yod pa yin no /
translated: But when the eye is open, it exists.

original: de ltar na snang ba yod na yod de de med na med do //
analyzed: de ltar na snang ba yod na yod de de med na med do //
translated: Thus, if light exists, it exists; if it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rgyu yod kyang yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i gsal ba yod na snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rgyu yod kyang yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i gsal ba yod na snang ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, even when the causes of the eye, etc. exist, if there is light from a lamp, etc., there is illumination.

original: de ltar mdun du gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs yod par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mdun du gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs yod par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the form of a pot, etc. that is in front exists,

original: snang ba la sogs pa yod kyang de med na med do //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa yod kyang de med na med do //
translated: even if light, etc. exist, if it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: yang de yod na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de yod na yod pa yin no //
translated: But if it exists, it exists.

original: de bzhin du yid la byed pa yod bas rnam par shes ba skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid la byed pa yod bas rnam par shes ba skye'o //
translated: In the same way, consciousness arises due to mental activity.

original: de med na med do //
analyzed: de med na med do //
translated: If it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yod kyang gnyid 'thug pa'i gnas skabs su med do //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yod kyang gnyid 'thug pa'i gnas skabs su med do //
translated: Even when a pot, etc. exist, it does not exist in the state of deep sleep.

original: yang de sdan  yod do //
analyzed: yang de sdan  yod do //
translated: And it is not the case that it is not.

original: de la re re gsal na rnam par shes pa skye pa med pas de thams cad kyi nus ba yin par dpag go //
analyzed: de la re re gsal na rnam par shes pa skye pa med pas de thams cad kyi nus ba yin par dpag go //
translated: If one of these is clear, the other is not, and consciousness does not arise. Therefore, we infer that the capacity of both is present in all.

original: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs la 'jug gi sgra la sogs pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs la 'jug gi sgra la sogs pa la ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the eye engages with visible form, but not with sound, etc.

original: mig gis sgra la sogs pa rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: mig gis sgra la sogs pa rtogs pa med de /
translated: The eye does not cognize sound, etc.

original: rna pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yongs su brtag pa don med par thal ba'i phyir dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yongs su brtag pa don med par thal ba'i phyir dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the ear faculty, etc., are meaningless, and it follows that the deaf, etc., would not exist.

original: de'i sgra la sogs pa skyed byed ma yin pa'i phyir gang de la snang ba yin skyed byed ma yin kyang snang na don thams cad mngon sum du gyur pas thams cad kyis thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩdbang po'i shes pa thams cad @152a * //
analyzed: de'i sgra la sogs pa skyed byed ma yin pa'i phyir gang de la snang ba yin skyed byed ma yin kyang snang na don thams cad mngon sum du gyur pas thams cad kyis thams cad shes par 'gyur ro // dbang po'i shes pa thams cad @152a * //
translated: Because it is not the producer of sound, etc., if it appears to the eye, even though it is not the producer, if it appears, all objects would be directly perceived, and everyone would know everything.

original: kyi gnas skabs 'di nyid do //
analyzed: kyi gnas skabs 'di nyid do //
translated: This is the case for all instances of sense consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyis rnam pa can skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyis rnam pa can skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eye consciousness, etc. arise with the aspect of the image of form, etc.

original: rnam pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'am /
translated: then they would be without aspect,

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can dag don rtogs pa med de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can dag don rtogs pa med de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or they would have the aspect of something else, and it is impossible for them to cognize their object.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar skyes bu rang gi de bzhin thams cad du mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar skyes bu rang gi de bzhin thams cad du mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Because, just as a person does not perceive himself, so too he does not perceive all things.

original: snang ba'i me long la de'i gzugs brnyan mthong bas des de rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i me long la de'i gzugs brnyan mthong bas des de rtogs pa'o //
translated: The reflection of his face is seen in a mirror, and by that he cognizes it.

original: gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba nyid rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs skyes bus nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba nyid rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs skyes bus nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of the reflection is the experience of the person‚Äôs own face.

original: de la gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba las gzhan dngos su nyams su myong ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de la gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba las gzhan dngos su nyams su myong ba ni mi srid do //
translated: There is no other direct experience of it.

original: de ltar don yod par smra ba thams cad nyid kyis kyang don gang du yang mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar don yod par smra ba thams cad nyid kyis kyang don gang du yang mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, all realists do not perceive any object directly.

original: de la shes pa me long lta bu la gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba nyid de nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de la shes pa me long lta bu la gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba nyid de nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of the reflection in the mirror-like cognition is the experience.

original: de mthong ba nyid don mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba nyid don mthong ba'o //
translated: The seeing of that is the seeing of the object.

original: gang gi phyir rang gis don mngon sum du byas pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gis don mngon sum du byas pa ni med do //
translated: Because there is no direct perception of the object by itself.

original: de mngon sum nyid yin na mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum nyid yin na mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were direct perception, it would be cognition, because it would have the nature of direct perception and the nature of consciousness.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis rnam par shes pa nyid bsgrub pas don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis rnam par shes pa nyid bsgrub pas don ni ma yin no //
translated: Since direct perception is established as consciousness, it is not the object.

original: gzhan yang don nyid mngon sum yin gyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang don nyid mngon sum yin gyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the object itself is direct perception, not consciousness.

original: de mngon sum ma yin ba nyid kyis thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum ma yin ba nyid kyis thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not direct perception, it would follow that everything would not be direct perception.

original: gzugs brnyan mngon sum du byas pas rang gi bzhin yang mngon sum du byas pa bzhin du de mngon sum nyid du bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan mngon sum du byas pas rang gi bzhin yang mngon sum du byas pa bzhin du de mngon sum nyid du bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the object is direct perception, just as one's own face is not direct perception when one's face is made into a reflection and made into direct perception.

original: de'i phyir na don mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na don mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object is not directly perceived.

original: de la gang yang sngon po'i rnam pa las shes pa gzhan gyi rnam par 'gyur na sngon po'i rnam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang yang sngon po'i rnam pa las shes pa gzhan gyi rnam par 'gyur na sngon po'i rnam pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if the cognition is transformed into something other than the aspect of blue, it is not the aspect of blue.

original: rnam par shes pa de rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That cognition would have the nature of permanence.

original: de nyid rang rig pa yin gyi de sngon po ni ma yin te sngon po'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rang rig pa yin gyi de sngon po ni ma yin te sngon po'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is self-awareness, not blue, because it is devoid of the aspect of blue.

original: yang dag pa'i rig pa la yod pa dang med pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba ma yin no //üîΩser po'i shes pa dang mi 'bral ba'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rig pa la yod pa dang med pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba ma yin no // ser po'i shes pa dang mi 'bral ba'am /
translated: In correct awareness, there is no absence of the aspect of existence.üîΩIt is not separate from the cognition of yellow,

original: sngon po dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: nor is it separate from blue.

original: gang de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ni yang dag @152b pa'i rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ni yang dag @152b pa'i rig pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not its nature is not correct awareness.

original: ser po'i shes ba ni nag po'i shes pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ser po'i shes ba ni nag po'i shes pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The cognition of yellow is not the cognition of black.

original: ji ltar me long la rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba ni rang gi bzhin gyi rnam pa yin gyi gzhan gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar me long la rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba ni rang gi bzhin gyi rnam pa yin gyi gzhan gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as the reflection of one‚Äôs face in a mirror has the aspect of one‚Äôs face and not the aspect of something else,

original: de yis rang gi bzhin nyid yang dag par rig pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: de yis rang gi bzhin nyid yang dag par rig pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin te /
translated: and it is one‚Äôs own face that is perceived, not something else,

original: de'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of its aspect,

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyis rnam par rig pas sngon po'i don gyi rnam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyis rnam par rig pas sngon po'i don gyi rnam pa ma yin te /
translated: in the same way, the object blue is not cognized by the cognition of something else,

original: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would be too much.

original: yang dag par rig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it cognized by a cognition that is not blue.

original: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa yang sngon po'i don rig pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa yang sngon po'i don rig pa po ma yin te /
translated: And a cognition that is devoid of aspect does not cognize the object blue,

original: gang gi phyir de don gyi rnam pa thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan thams cad dang bral ba'i me long ge dkyil 'khor bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de don gyi rnam pa thams cad dang bral pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan thams cad dang bral ba'i me long ge dkyil 'khor bzhin no //
translated: because it is devoid of all aspects of the object, like a mirror disc devoid of all reflections.

original: don rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur gang gi phyir me long gi ngos la gzugs brnyan ma lus pa dang bral te gzugs brnyan dang bral bas na rang gi bzhin la sogs pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur gang gi phyir me long gi ngos la gzugs brnyan ma lus pa dang bral te gzugs brnyan dang bral bas na rang gi bzhin la sogs pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: How can the object be cognized? Because the mirror surface is devoid of all images, being devoid of images, it does not cognize its own face, etc.

original: de bzhin du shes pa ni gang du yang don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs brnyan med pas ji ltar don nyid rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa ni gang du yang don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs brnyan med pas ji ltar don nyid rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, consciousness does not have the form of an image of the nature of the object anywhere, so how can the object itself be cognized?

original: don rang gi bzhin ltar rang gi mngon sum du mi 'gyur te sngon du bstan pa'i skyon nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don rang gi bzhin ltar rang gi mngon sum du mi 'gyur te sngon du bstan pa'i skyon nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The object is not directly perceived by itself, like one‚Äôs own face, because of the previously stated fault.

original: de bas rnam pa med pa dang gzhan gyi rnam pa can gnyis kyis don yang dag par rig ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de bas rnam pa med pa dang gzhan gyi rnam pa can gnyis kyis don yang dag par rig ba ni mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for the object to be cognized by either the formless or the form of another.

original: zhar la byung ba ni des chog go //
analyzed: zhar la byung ba ni des chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
translated: Only a part has been taught.

original: 'di las gzhan du ni gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas ma bris so //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan du ni gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas ma bris so //
translated: I have not written more than this for fear of verbosity.

original: de ltar gyur pa gang las she na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa gang las she na /
translated: From what is this so?

original: nges 'byung zhing zhes pa ni nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nges 'byung zhing zhes pa ni nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The field of renunciation is stated with ‚Äúrenunciation, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di nges par bye brag tu lha rnams nges par byed pas na nges par 'byung ba ste a'a li dang k'a li'i tshogs so //
analyzed: 'di nges par bye brag tu lha rnams nges par byed pas na nges par 'byung ba ste a'a li dang k'a li'i tshogs so //
translated: Since this is the renunciation of the gods, it is renunciation, the collection of vowels and consonants.

original: de nas yang gang las she na /
analyzed: de nas yang gang las she na /
translated: Then, from what?

original: sgra'i tshul las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra'i tshul las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúfrom the method of sound, etc.‚Äù

original: sgra'i tshul ni sgra tsam ste //
analyzed: sgra'i tshul ni sgra tsam ste //
translated: The method of sound is mere sound.

original: de so so'i rten du 'gyur ba phra mo'o //
analyzed: de so so'i rten du 'gyur ba phra mo'o //
translated: That is the subtle support of each.

original: de'i gzugs ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gzugs ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Its form is the nature.

original: gdan ji lta bar dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs kyi steng du h'um ngo //
analyzed: gdan ji lta bar dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs kyi steng du h'um ngo //
translated: As with the seat, on top of the collection of vowels and consonants is the syllable h≈´·πÉ.

original: de las skyes pa ni sna tshogs rdo rje ste lte ba'i steng du gdan la gnas pa'i h'um yig go //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni sna tshogs rdo rje ste lte ba'i steng du gdan la gnas pa'i h'um yig go //
translated: From that arises the variegated vajra, the syllable h≈´·πÉ on the seat on top of the hub.

original: de'i steng du bar mchod par h'um nag @153a * //
analyzed: de'i steng du bar mchod par h'um nag @153a * //
translated: On top of that, in the middle, is a black h≈´·πÉ.

original: po'o ; / de'i steng du a'a: dmar po'o //
analyzed: po'o ; / de'i steng du a'a: dmar po'o //
translated: On top of that is a red ƒÅ·∏•.

original: de'i steng du aom dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du aom dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On top of that is a white o·πÉ.

original: aom la sogs pa rang bzhin med par bya ste /
analyzed: aom la sogs pa rang bzhin med par bya ste /
translated: The nature of the syllable o·πÉ and so forth is to be made nonexistent.

original: gang n'a da tsam de ni sgra tsam ste de thig le la'o //
analyzed: gang n'a da tsam de ni sgra tsam ste de thig le la'o //
translated: That mere nada is just sound, which is in the bindu.

original: de zla ba phyed pa la'o //
analyzed: de zla ba phyed pa la'o //
translated: That is in the half-moon.

original: de ao la'o //
analyzed: de ao la'o //
translated: That is in the syllable o·πÉ.

original: de aa yig go //
analyzed: de aa yig go //
translated: That is the letter a.

original: de blo'i thig le tsheg drag gnyis la'o //üîΩde'i phyi'i blo'i dbyug pa la'o //
analyzed: de blo'i thig le tsheg drag gnyis la'o // de'i phyi'i blo'i dbyug pa la'o //
translated: That is in the two anusvƒÅras of the bindu of the mind.üîΩThat is in the external club of the mind.

original: de ao'i rgyab tu 'byar ba'i glo'i dbyug pa la'o //
analyzed: de ao'i rgyab tu 'byar ba'i glo'i dbyug pa la'o //
translated: That is in the club of the mind that is attached to the back of the o·πÉ.

original: de aa yig gi mgo bo la'o //
analyzed: de aa yig gi mgo bo la'o //
translated: That is at the head of the letter a.

original: de h'um yig gi dang po n'a da tsam mo //
analyzed: de h'um yig gi dang po n'a da tsam mo //
translated: That is the mere nada of the first syllable of h≈´·πÉ.

original: n'a da de thig le'o //
analyzed: n'a da de thig le'o //
translated: That nada is the bindu.

original: de mgo bo la'o //
analyzed: de mgo bo la'o //
translated: That is at the head.

original: de zla tshes la'o //
analyzed: de zla tshes la'o //
translated: That is in the crescent moon.

original: de las thig le lo'o //
analyzed: de las thig le lo'o //
translated: That bindu is in the la.

original: de ha la'o //
analyzed: de ha la'o //
translated: That is in the ha.

original: de ha'i phyed stod kyi cha la'o //

translated: By familiarization with that very [non-conceptuality] in a way that is free from attachment, all afflictions are purified, and one actually becomes the co-emergent pristine awareness of a buddha.

analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par mi rtog pa nyid nga yin no //

analyzed: de yang thabs dang shes rab gnyis su gzung ba la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang na dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang dga' bral rnams su rnyed par dka' ba ste gsum du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa med do //

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i sgo nas rnyed par sla ba blo la bzhag ste rnyed par dga' ba nyid du gsungs so //

analyzed: gang yang rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag gi ngo bo ma yin zhes bya bar dgongs so //

analyzed: de ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nyams su myong ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnyed par dka'o //

original: gang gi phyir mtshan nyid @154b dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la nye bar dmigs pa thams cad spangs pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //

original: de nas sprul pa dang / longs spyod pa dang / chos rnam par dag pa'i sku'i rang bzhin dang / stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid ces bya ba ste de rnams bsdu pa'o //

analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi gzhung gzhan yin pa la 'gal ba med do //

analyzed: sngar ma byung ba nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba dang 'brel pas sngon ma byung ba nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

translated: If it is asked whether this is related to the compiler himself, because it is said, ‚ÄúMonks, it should be collected like this: ‚ÄòThus have I heard at one time,‚Äô and so on,‚Äù it is not so.

analyzed: gsungs pa'i rjod byed dang brjod bya'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyud bsdus pa'i phyir ro // gal te bcom ldan 'das ma ston pa po yin na /

analyzed: de'i tshe bzhugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don dang ji ltar 'byor zhe na /

original: 'dir don tha dad gsum yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don tha dad gsum yin te /

original: rgyu 'bras thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras thabs kyi rang bzhin no //

analyzed: 'bras bu ni che ba'i ngo bo nyid kun tu bzang po'o //

analyzed: rgyud 'di goms pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par rdzogs pa nyid de /

analyzed: rgya yang dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i tshogs so //

original: rgyud la rgyud du brjod pa ste //
analyzed: rgyud la rgyud du brjod pa ste //

original: de rgyun de yang rnam pa gsum //üîΩrten dang thabs dang rnam pas ni //
analyzed: de rgyun de yang rnam pa gsum // rten dang thabs dang rnam pas ni //

analyzed: rgyud don gsum gyis bsdus pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs so //

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis shin tu mdor bsdus nas ma lus pa'i rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba bstan to //üîΩde nas / he ru ka dpal yang dag sbyor //

analyzed: 'di na mar shin tu rgyas par ni rgyud rdzogs pa'i bar gyis gsungs so //

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa la zhe na /

analyzed: dri zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: dpal he ru ka dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi'i rnal 'byor ni rnam par shes pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhi'i rnal 'byor ni rnam par shes pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The yoga of Sri Heruka and the four dakinis, and so on, is the wheel of consciousness.

original: 'di rnams la kun du spyod pa med de gdams ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams la kun du spyod pa med de gdams ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not have conduct because they do not have instructions.

original: ji srid zla ba drug tu bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya ste mtshan ma thob par byas nas /
analyzed: ji srid zla ba drug tu bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya ste mtshan ma thob par byas nas /
translated: One should meditate and do repetition for six months, until one obtains a sign.

original: de nas zla ba bdun du rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba bdun du rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Then, for seven months, there is the conduct of the yoginis.

original: de ltar byas kyang gal te ma grub na yang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang gal te ma grub na yang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: If one does not succeed even though one does this, one should meditate in the same way.

original: 'dir zla ba sum cu rtsa drug gis nges par 'grub par 'gyur ba ni gdams ngag go //
analyzed: 'dir zla ba sum cu rtsa drug gis nges par 'grub par 'gyur ba ni gdams ngag go //
translated: Here, the instruction is that it is definitely accomplished in thirty-six months.

original: bar ma chad bar rgyud du bsgoms na lo gcig gis so //
analyzed: bar ma chad bar rgyud du bsgoms na lo gcig gis so //
translated: If one meditates continuously, it is in one year.

original: de nas zla ba drug tu goms pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de nas zla ba drug tu goms pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Then, in six months, by the process of practice.

original: me la @158a * //
analyzed: me la @158a * //
translated: By the yoga of fire,

original: sogs pa'i sbyor bas mngon spyod la sogs pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sbyor bas mngon spyod la sogs pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: and so on, one should understand that the destruction of enemies, and so on, is similar.

original: de ltar mngon spyod ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i me'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon spyod ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'i me'i dus na'o //
translated: Thus, the destruction of enemies is at the time of the fire of the mind wheel.

original: zhi ba la ni gsung gi 'khor lo'i chu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni gsung gi 'khor lo'i chu'i dus na'o //
translated: Pacification is at the time of the water of the speech wheel.

original: rgyas pa la ni sku'i 'khor lo'i dbang chen gyi dus na'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa la ni sku'i 'khor lo'i dbang chen gyi dus na'o //
translated: Increase is at the time of the great lord of the body wheel.

original: skrod pa la ni dur khrod kyi 'khor lo'i rlung gi dus na'o //
analyzed: skrod pa la ni dur khrod kyi 'khor lo'i rlung gi dus na'o //
translated: Expulsion is at the time of the wind of the charnel ground wheel.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni gang yang rung ba bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni gang yang rung ba bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on any yoginƒ´.

original: me'i rlung ni sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: me'i rlung ni sor bzhi'o //
translated: The wind of fire is four fingerbreadths.

original: dbang chen gyi rlung ni sor bcu'o //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi rlung ni sor bcu'o //
translated: The wind of the great lord is ten fingerbreadths.

original: rlung gi rlung ni sor drug go //
analyzed: rlung gi rlung ni sor drug go //
translated: The wind of the wind is six fingerbreadths.

original: chu'i rlung ni sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i rlung ni sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The wind of water is twelve fingerbreadths.

original: me dang dbang chen rlung dang chu //üîΩbzhi dang bcu dang drug cu gnyis //
analyzed: me dang dbang chen rlung dang chu // bzhi dang bcu dang drug cu gnyis //
translated: Fire, water, wind, and earthüîΩare four, ten, sixty-two,üîΩand sixty-four fingerbreadths in extent,

original: sor mo'i tshad kyis phyir 'byung ba'i //üîΩgnas ni nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sor mo'i tshad kyis phyir 'byung ba'i // gnas ni nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: respectively, in the exhaled breath.

original: 'on kyang steng du 'gro zhing dro ba ni me'i rlung ngo //üîΩshin du grang ba yang ma yin //
analyzed: 'on kyang steng du 'gro zhing dro ba ni me'i rlung ngo // shin du grang ba yang ma yin //
translated: The upward-moving and hot breath is the fire wind.

original: shin tu dro ba yang ma yin zhing sna'i bug gang bar rgyu ba ni sa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: shin tu dro ba yang ma yin zhing sna'i bug gang bar rgyu ba ni sa'i rlung ngo //
translated: The breath that is neither too cold nor too hot and moves through both nostrils is the earth wind.

original: logs su rtsub par rgyu ba ni rlung gi rlung ngo //
analyzed: logs su rtsub par rgyu ba ni rlung gi rlung ngo //
translated: The breath that moves through the right nostril is the wind wind.üîΩThe breath that moves through the left nostril is the water wind.

original: shin tu grang ba 'og tu rgyu ba ni chu'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: shin tu grang ba 'og tu rgyu ba ni chu'i rlung ngo //
translated: The breath that moves through the lower part of the body is the earth wind.

original: de la me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la me ni gru gsum dmar po rtse mo bdun gyis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: de la me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la me ni gru gsum dmar po rtse mo bdun gyis mtshan pa'o //
translated: The mandala of fire is triangular, red, and marked with seven flames.

original: dbang chen ni ser po gru bzhi rdo rjes mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang chen ni ser po gru bzhi rdo rjes mtshan pa'o //
translated: The mandala of earth is square, yellow, and marked with a vajra.

original: rlung ni gzhu lta bu sngon po bdun gyis mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: rlung ni gzhu lta bu sngon po bdun gyis mtshan pa'o //
translated: The mandala of wind is bow-shaped, blue, and marked with seven.

original: chu ni zlum po dkar po bum pas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: chu ni zlum po dkar po bum pas mtshan pa'o //
translated: The mandala of water is round, white, and marked with a vase.

original: rlung phyir rgyu bas me la sogs pa'i dus go bar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung phyir rgyu bas me la sogs pa'i dus go bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand the times of fire, etc. by the exhalation of the wind.

original: rigs ldan gyi mchod pa bstan pa ni dngos grub dang por bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rigs ldan gyi mchod pa bstan pa ni dngos grub dang por bstan pa ste /
translated: The worship of the messenger is taught as the first power,

original: de nyid bsgrub bya gtso bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub bya gtso bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: because she is the principal one to be accomplished.

original: rigs ldan ji tsam yin zhes pa la /
analyzed: rigs ldan ji tsam yin zhes pa la /

original: pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: sngar rigs ldan zhes bya ba ni rigs gcig pa tsam la gcig gi tshig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: sngar rigs ldan zhes bya ba ni rigs gcig pa tsam la gcig gi tshig tu byas pa'o //
translated: The previously mentioned ‚Äúmessenger‚Äù is a singular form of the word for ‚Äúone of the same clan. ‚Äù

original: de yang sems can sdug bsngal ba la gdung bas na pho nya'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can sdug bsngal ba la gdung bas na pho nya'o //

original: pho nya zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: pho nya zhes bya ba ni mang po'i tshig go //

original: rigs ldan dang pho nya ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rigs ldan dang pho nya ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúMessenger‚Äù and ‚Äúone of the same clan‚Äù are synonyms.

original: de lhan cig skyes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin dang mnyam pa mkha' 'gro ma bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lhan cig skyes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin dang mnyam pa mkha' 'gro ma bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: She is innate, equal in nature to the BhagavƒÅn, and is the four dakinis, etc.

original: de de'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de de'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Her nature is the gnosis of that.

original: dngos grub ni gshin rje brtan ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
analyzed: dngos grub ni gshin rje brtan ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
translated: The power is the eight yoginis, such as Dandinƒ´, etc.

original: tha ma ni sku'i 'khor lor gtogs pa'i sa 'og na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni sku'i 'khor lor gtogs pa'i sa 'og na gnas pa'o //

original: 'bring ni gsung gi 'khor lor gtogs pa'i sa spyod do //
analyzed: 'bring ni gsung gi 'khor lor gtogs pa'i sa spyod do //
translated: The middling are those who live on the earth, belonging to the speech wheel.

original: @158b mchog ni thugs kyi 'khor lor gtogs pa'i mkha' la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: @158b mchog ni thugs kyi 'khor lor gtogs pa'i mkha' la spyod pa'o //

original: 'dis ni rnal 'byor sum cu rtsa drug nyid mchod par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnal 'byor sum cu rtsa drug nyid mchod par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that these thirty-six yogis should be worshipped.

original: lus dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsgrub bya dpal he ru ka yin par grub bo //
analyzed: lus dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsgrub bya dpal he ru ka yin par grub bo //
translated: It is established that the two, the body and the outer ma·πá·∏çala, are the glorious Heruka to be accomplished.

original: ci goms pa dang ldan pas bsgom par bya zhes pa la ;
analyzed: ci goms pa dang ldan pas bsgom par bya zhes pa la ;
translated: What is to be cultivated by one who is familiar?

original: yid nang du chud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yid nang du chud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is stated, ‚ÄúThe mind is absorbed inside,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dod pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Desire is form, sound, and so on.

original: de rnams kyis sam dpal he ru ka'i dngos grub ni 'dod pa'i dngos grub ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis sam dpal he ru ka'i dngos grub ni 'dod pa'i dngos grub ste /
translated: The accomplishment of those or the accomplishment of the glorious Heruka is the accomplishment of desire.

original: bsgom par bya ba'i dngos po ni rang la yod par bya'o zhes ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i dngos po ni rang la yod par bya'o zhes ba'i don to //

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub yod pa yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub yod pa yin //

original: zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: Up to here.

original: 'dod pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs //üîΩzhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The desired things are form, sound, and so on.

original: ji lta bu nyid ces pa la yid ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji lta bu nyid ces pa la yid ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: As for the ‚Äúsuchness‚Äù of the mind, it is said to be the mind.

original: rnam par shes pas shes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas shes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù is the object of consciousness.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam shes dang // yang na rnam par rig byed do ;
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam shes dang // yang na rnam par rig byed do ;
translated: Mind, thought, and consciousness, or else, the expression of consciousness.

original: / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: nang du chud pa ni rang dang dbyer med pa'i dpal he ru ka'i gzugs su bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nang du chud pa ni rang dang dbyer med pa'i dpal he ru ka'i gzugs su bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSubsumed‚Äù means to be conceived in the form of glorious Heruka, inseparable from oneself.

original: 'dod pa thams cad la longs spyod pas dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor 'grub po zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad la longs spyod pas dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor 'grub po zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that by enjoying all desired things, the yoga of glorious Heruka is accomplished.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la //
translated: ‚ÄúBy relying on all the enjoyments of desire,

original: brten na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: brten na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: one will quickly be successful.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ni'i sgra ni nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nyid kyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means ‚Äújust.‚Äù

original: bya ba mi byed pas na bsgrub bya 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba mi byed pas na bsgrub bya 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without action, the goal is not accomplished.

original: bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The essence of meditation is mental in nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of enjoyment of objects such as form is the external worship.

original: dngos kyi mchod pa ni rang rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos kyi mchod pa ni rang rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The actual worship is stated in the line ‚Äúone‚Äôs own substance,‚Äù etc.

original: phyi rol gyi shes rab rgyud gzhan nas gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can mchod pa'i don du byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //üîΩde gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa las skyes pa'i thig las bdud rtsi myang ba'i rang bzhin gyis dga' bar byas la longs spyad na sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shes rab rgyud gzhan nas gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can mchod pa'i don du byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o // de gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa las skyes pa'i thig las bdud rtsi myang ba'i rang bzhin gyis dga' bar byas la longs spyad na sangs rgyas te /
translated: One should generate the Thought of Enlightenment for the sake of worship with the external wisdom, who has the characteristic stated in other tantras.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa phung po lnga dang / byang chub sems dpa' ste mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa phung po lnga dang / byang chub sems dpa' ste mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mchod par bya'o //
translated: Having made love with the nectar-nature arising from the drop generated from their union, one should enjoy the Buddha, i.e., the five aggregates such as form and feeling, and the Bodhisattva, i.e., the nature of the eye, etc.

original: de ltar thun gsum du rjes su gnas shing @159a * //
analyzed: de ltar thun gsum du rjes su gnas shing @159a * //
translated: Thus, one should worship in three sessions.

original: dngos su mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su mchod par bya'o //
translated: And one should worship in actuality.

original: de yang / mig yangs khu ba blangs nas ni //
analyzed: de yang / mig yangs khu ba blangs nas ni //
translated: And that is stated in the line ‚ÄúHaving taken the wide-eyed one‚Äôs fluid,‚Äù etc.

original: blo ldan brtan pas yid kyis bza' //
analyzed: blo ldan brtan pas yid kyis bza' //
translated: The wise one, the steadfast one, should eat with the mind.

original: 'di de sngags rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'di de sngags rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: This is the offering of body, speech, and mind

original: sku gsung thugs kyi mchod pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi mchod pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: of all the mantras.

original: gsang ba'i mchod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The secret offering is the experience of the innate.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i mchod pa'i rnam pa bzhi 'grub po zhes dgongs te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i mchod pa'i rnam pa bzhi 'grub po zhes dgongs te /
translated: It is intended that the four kinds of perfect offering are accomplished.

original: rnal 'byor 'dis sngon du bsags pa'i sdig pa dang / bsod nams kyang gzung ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pas byas pas nyams nas sngon ma yin pa nyid mngon par zhen pa med pa'i bsod nams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'dis sngon du bsags pa'i sdig pa dang / bsod nams kyang gzung ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pas byas pas nyams nas sngon ma yin pa nyid mngon par zhen pa med pa'i bsod nams su 'gyur ro //
translated: By this yoga, even the previously accumulated evil and merit, which were produced by the adherence to grasping, etc., are destroyed, and become merit without adherence, which is not as before.

original: de nas dngos grub ni mthong ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas dngos grub ni mthong ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, with regard to power, he declares, ‚Äúvision, etc.‚Äù

original: mthong ba ni mig gis nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mig gis nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: Vision is the perception by the eye.

original: reg pa ni lus kyi dbang pos reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni lus kyi dbang pos reg pa'o //
translated: Touch is the contact by the body faculty.

original: thos pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos so //
analyzed: thos pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos so //
translated: Hearing is by the ear faculty.

original: dran pa ni yid kyi dbang pos so //
analyzed: dran pa ni yid kyi dbang pos so //
translated: Recollection is by the mind faculty.

original: 'di rnams kyi dpal he ru ka dang 'brel ba'i rgyur gyur pas skyes bu gzhan yang grol bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dpal he ru ka dang 'brel ba'i rgyur gyur pas skyes bu gzhan yang grol bar 'gyur te //
translated: Since these are the causes for the glory of Heruka, other persons also will be liberated.

original: lus kyi nyes par spyad pa la sogs pas byas par gyur pas sdig pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi nyes par spyad pa la sogs pas byas par gyur pas sdig pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All sins are purified by the performance of the sins of the body, etc.

original: sdig pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis sdig pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis sdig pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the yoga of non-sin, one becomes sinless.

original: de ltar de nyid go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar de nyid go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, that very thing is taught in order, is the meaning.

original: 'di bden don nam zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'di bden don nam zhes pa la /
translated: Here, if this is the truth is said.

original: the tshom med ces gsungs te /
analyzed: the tshom med ces gsungs te /
translated: There is no doubt, is said.

original: yid gnyis mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid gnyis mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: mthong ba la sogs pas gzung ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa las grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pas gzung ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa las grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: One is liberated from the attachment to the apprehended, etc. by seeing, etc.

original: gsang ba lhan cig skyes pa rtogs pa'i dus kyi rnal 'byor yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba lhan cig skyes pa rtogs pa'i dus kyi rnal 'byor yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the yoga of the time of the realization of the innate secret.

original: gsang ba'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchod pa'o //

original: de la yang de nyid kyis ni khams gsum nyid kyang ci yang ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la yang de nyid kyis ni khams gsum nyid kyang ci yang ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: There, that very thing means that even the three realms are nothing at all.

original: kha cig na re the tshom med ces bya ba ni rtog pa med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re the tshom med ces bya ba ni rtog pa med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that ‚Äúwithout doubt‚Äù means without conceptualization.

original: rnal 'byor pa mthong bas ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa mthong bas ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it for the yogi/nƒ´ who sees?

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says ‚Äúthe yoga of ≈örƒ´ Heruka‚Äù and so on.

original: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor nyid /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor nyid /
translated: The yoga of ≈örƒ´ Heruka is the supreme,

original: mchog ces pa ni mthong ba tsam gyis sdig pa thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces pa ni mthong ba tsam gyis sdig pa thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it destroys all sins merely by seeing it.

original: 'di nyid kyis dag par byed pas na bsod nams so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis dag par byed pas na bsod nams so //
translated: It is merit because it purifies just this.

original: dag byed ni nyon mongs pa'i @159b dri ma dang bral bar byed pas na'o //
analyzed: dag byed ni nyon mongs pa'i @159b dri ma dang bral bar byed pas na'o //

analyzed: bder gshegs ni ji lta bar zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis ni bsgom par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: The word thus means that one should meditate according to the speech of the Tathagata.üîΩ The word heroine refers to the twenty-four yoginis.

original: dpa' bo dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ma ni dpa' @170b bo rnal 'byor ma ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ma ni dpa' @170b bo rnal 'byor ma ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The word hero refers to the twenty-four heroes.üîΩ The word together means that the heroes and heroines are together.

original: gnyis su med pa'i dpa' bo spangs pa ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i dpa' bo spangs pa ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: The abandonment of the nondual hero is the twelfth.

original: thung du ni bde bar gshegs pa'i lung yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thung du ni bde bar gshegs pa'i lung yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The short is the Sugata's transmission.

original: de rnams dgod pa ni de'i cho ga ste /
analyzed: de rnams dgod pa ni de'i cho ga ste /
translated: The arrangement of those is its ritual.

original: de rjod par byed pa'i le'u ste de yang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i le'u ste de yang bzhi pa'o //
translated: The chapter that describes that is the fourth.

original: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel las le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel las le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourth chapter in the commentary on the Shri-Chakrasamvara.

original: // / bsgom pa tsam 'ba' zhig gi dngos grub sgrub byed ma yin pas /
analyzed: // / bsgom pa tsam 'ba' zhig gi dngos grub sgrub byed ma yin pas /
translated: Since the powers are not accomplished by mere meditation,

original: 'on kyang bzlas pas kyang zhes pa la de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bzlas pas kyang zhes pa la de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: nevertheless, it is said that by recitation as well, and so on, beginning with then.

original: rgyu mtshan de nyid kyi phyir sngags btu ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de nyid kyi phyir sngags btu ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, the mantra is extracted.

original: btu ba ni thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btu ba ni thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: thams cad ni chos rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ni chos rnams so //

analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'di las 'byung bas na 'byung bar byed pas so //

original: sna tshogs ni kha dog sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni kha dog sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: lte ba zhes pa ni lte ba la'o //
analyzed: lte ba zhes pa ni lte ba la'o //

original: mi shigs pa ni kun tu thob cing zhes pa dge ba 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shigs pa ni kun tu thob cing zhes pa dge ba 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
